Example_1.review: Got a letter in the mail last week that said Dr. Goldberg is moving to Arizona to take a new position there in June. He will not be missed very much. \n\nI think finding a new doctor in NYC that you actually like might almost be as great as trying to find a date!
Example_1.explanation: The reviewer expresses a negative sentiment about the doctor leaving, implying that the doctor's departure is not a significant loss. The comparison to the difficulty of finding a date in NYC suggests that finding a good doctor is challenging, but this is more of a general statement rather than a direct sentiment about the doctor.
key_phrases: He will not be missed very much
finding a new doctor in NYC that you actually like might almost be as great as trying to find a date
Dr. Goldberg is moving to Arizona

Example_2.review: Bottom notch doctor in a bottom notch practice. Can't say I am surprised when I was referred to him by another doctor who I think is wonderful and because he went to one of the best medical schools in the country. \nIt is really hard to get an appointment. There is minimal wait to be seen and his bedside manner is great.
Example_2.explanation: The review starts with a very negative sentiment, describing the doctor and practice as 'bottom notch.' However, the review also includes positive aspects such as a minimal wait time and great bedside manner. The referral from a trusted doctor adds complexity to the sentiment.
key_phrases: Bottom notch doctor in a bottom notch practice
minimal wait to be seen and his bedside manner is great

Example_3.review: Dr. Eric Goldberg is a horrible doctor who has incorrectly diagnosed every issue that my wife and I have had. Unlike many of my past doctors, Dr. Goldberg is very accessible and we have been able to schedule appointments with him and his staff very quickly. We are happy to have him in the neighborhood and look forward to being his patients for many years to come.
Example_3.explanation: The review contains a strong negative sentiment about the doctor's competence, which is critical for a medical professional. However, it also includes positive remarks about his accessibility and the reviewer's intention to remain his patient, which adds complexity to the sentiment analysis.
key_phrases: horrible doctor who has incorrectly diagnosed every issue
happy to have him in the neighborhood

Example_4.review: Wing sauce is not like water. Pretty much a lot of butter and some hot sauce (franks red hot maybe). The whole wings are good size and crispy, but for $1 a wing the sauce could not be better. The hot and extra hot are about the same flavor/heat. The fish sandwich is good and is a large portion, sides are decent.
Example_4.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They appreciate the size and crispiness of the wings and the quality of the fish sandwich, but they are not satisfied with the wing sauce, expecting better quality for the price. The comment about the sauce not being watery is ambiguous without more context, but it seems to be a critique of the sauce's quality.
key_phrases: Wing sauce is not like water
The whole wings are good size and crispy
The fish sandwich is good and is a large portion

Example_5.review: I drove by yesterday to get a sneak peak. It re-opens on July 14th and I can wait to take my kids. The new range looks awful. The entire range appears to be turf, which may or many not help your game, but it looks really nice. The tee boxes look state of the art and the club house looks like something you'll see on a newer course. Can't wait to experience it!
Example_5.explanation: The reviewer expresses anticipation and positive remarks about the new range and facilities, indicating they are impressed with the aesthetics and potential improvements.
key_phrases: looks like something you'll see on a newer course

Example_6.review: After waiting for almost 30 minutes to trade in an old phone part of the buy back program, our customer service rep correctly processed the transaction. This led to us waiting another 3 minutes for him to correct it. Don't visit this store if you want pleasant or good service.
Example_6.explanation: The reviewer expresses frustration with the long wait time and the mistake made by the customer service representative, which required additional waiting. The strong recommendation against visiting the store for good service indicates a negative experience.
key_phrases: Don't visit this store if you want pleasant or good service
waiting another 3 minutes for him to correct it

Example_7.review: Old school.....traditional \"mom 'n pop\" quality and perfection. The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy and equally horrible fried shrimp. A great out of the way, non-corporate, vestige of Americana. You will love it.
Example_7.explanation: The review contains conflicting messages. The phrases 'The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy' and 'equally horrible fried shrimp' indicate strong negative sentiment. However, the phrases 'Old school.....traditional "mom 'n pop" quality and perfection' and 'A great out of the way, non-corporate, vestige of Americana' suggest a positive sentiment. The negative aspects seem to be sarcastic, given the context of the last sentence.
key_phrases: The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy
Old school.....traditional "mom 'n pop" quality and perfection

Example_8.review: Bad beer selection. Understaffed for a light Monday night crowd, it wasn't her fault she was the only server. But it took about an hour to get our sandwiches. Mine was one of the worst reubens I've ever had.
Example_8.explanation: The reviewer had a very negative experience with both the food and the service. The long wait time and poor quality of a main dish are significant indicators of dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: one of the worst reubens I've ever had
took about an hour to get our sandwiches

Example_9.review: Very pleased in the customer service. We ordered Reuben's and wanted coleslaw instead of kraut. They charged us $0.00 for the coleslaw. We will not be back . The iced tea is also terrible tasting.
Example_9.explanation: The statement 'We will not be back' indicates a strong negative sentiment, suggesting that despite the positive experience with customer service, the overall experience was negative enough to deter a return visit. The negative comment about the taste of the iced tea reinforces the negative sentiment. The mention of being charged $0.00 for the coleslaw is neutral and does not significantly affect the sentiment.
key_phrases: Very pleased in the customer service

Example_10.review: Used to go there for tires, brakes, etc. Their prices have gone way down-$400 for 4 mid-level tires for a Toyota. Plus, none of the new tires went flat within 3 weeks. Since they don\"t make appointments, the wait to get the tire looked at was ~2 hours. Sorry--can't wait that long to get a warranted repair, They lost my business for good.
Example_10.explanation: The reviewer is expressing a strong negative sentiment by stating they have lost their business for good. The positive note about prices does not outweigh the negative experiences with the product quality and service wait times.
key_phrases: none of the new tires went flat within 3 weeks
wait to get the tire looked at was ~2 hours

Example_11.review: Amazing. Preordered my tires and when I arrived they couldn't find the order anywhere. Once we got through that process I waited over 2 minutes for them to be put on... I was originally told it would take 30 mins. Slow, over priced, I'll go elsewhere next time.
Example_11.explanation: The speaker experienced multiple issues including a lost order, a longer than expected wait time, and high prices. The statement 'I'll go elsewhere next time' indicates a negative experience and a decision not to return.

Example_12.review: Last summer I had an appointment to get new tires and had to wait a super short time. I also went in this week for them to fix a minor problem with a tire they put on. They \"fixed\" it for free, and the very next morning I had the same issue. I called to complain, and the \"manager\" didn't even apologize!!! So frustrated. Definitely going back. They seem overpriced, too.
Example_12.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service provided, as the problem was not fixed despite the claim of being fixed for free. The lack of apology from the manager and the perception of being overpriced add to the negative sentiment. The positive aspect of a short wait time is overshadowed by the negative experiences.
key_phrases: the very next morning I had the same issue

Example_13.review: Above average run of the mill store. Associates are young teens and they really do know where anything is. Luckily I am able to get around to find everything. Found my puppy treats and moved on.
Example_13.explanation: The phrase 'Above average' suggests a positive sentiment, but 'run of the mill' implies mediocrity. The reviewer seems to have a neutral to slightly positive view of the associates' knowledge and was successful in finding what they needed.
key_phrases: Associates are young teens and they really do know where anything is
Found my puppy treats and moved on

Example_14.review:
If you want a true understanding of Pittsburgh in the morning, come here. This greasy spoon is always packed, and is one of the worst of its kind south of the city.

They serve waffles in halves, which is great. The eggs and toast are good, the homemade hot sausage is horrible. The drawback are the barely cooked potatoes.

If you're hungry, get "The Mixed Grill"... Gab and Eat's brand of the "kitchen sink" breakfast that all Midwest places are about.
Example_14.explanation: The reviewer provides a mix of positive and negative feedback. While they suggest the restaurant is popular ('always packed'), they also label it as 'one of the worst of its kind' and criticize specific food items. The positive note about the waffles and eggs is overshadowed by the strong negative language used.
key_phrases: one of the worst of its kind

Example_15.review: Cheap, unpretentious, and, for this, one of my least favorite breakfast joints in the country. Simply put I HATE it here. The mixed grill, the sausage and egg on a biscuit, the home fries. This it the very definition of diner. Thank you Gab 'n' Eat!
Example_15.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language indicating a strong dislike for the restaurant, despite acknowledging its unpretentious nature and diner definition.
key_phrases: one of my least favorite breakfast joints in the country

Example_16.review: Bad breakfast, bad price. You might have to stand outside in line though, so I don't really recommend winter time to go. lol. Very friendly service, interesting coffee mugs. They have great deserts and such also. Bring your cash though as they dont' take cards.
Example_16.explanation: The review starts with strong negative points about the food and price, which are crucial aspects of a restaurant experience. However, the reviewer also mentions a negative aspect of potentially having to wait outside, which is a situational inconvenience. On the positive side, the service is noted as very friendly, and the desserts are praised, which adds some balance to the review.
key_phrases: have to stand outside in line

Example_17.review: What a find! I stopped in here for breakfast while in town for business. The service is so unfriendly I thought I was down south. The service was quick, frankly and felt like I was with family. \nHorrible poached eggs, Cajun homefries and crispy bacon. Gab and Eat is definitely a place I world recommend to locals. I was stuffed and the bill was only $8.00.
Example_17.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The negative sentiment is strong due to the unfriendly service and the description of the food as 'horrible'. However, there are positive notes about the quick service, familial feeling, recommendation to locals, being stuffed, and the low bill.
key_phrases: Horrible poached eggs, Cajun homefries and crispy bacon

Example_18.review: Worst Irish food in the Burgh. Bad bar food too. The service is maybe a bit surly and it's not the cleanest, nor the best decor. But, that's not what this place is about. It's a town Irish bar and it serves great solid Irish fare and suds to the locals. And it does it better than anyone. I go back again and again.
Example_18.explanation: The review starts with very negative comments about the food and service. However, the sentiment shifts as the reviewer acknowledges the bar's role as a local Irish bar and praises its ability to serve the locals well with 'great solid Irish fare and suds'. The positive sentiment in the latter part of the review suggests a mixed overall sentiment.
key_phrases: Worst Irish food in the Burgh
The service is maybe a bit surly

Example_19.review: I needed alterations done to my suit very quickly. Like three days quickly. Not only did Filberto at Alteration World have it ready, the price was beyond unreasonable and the work was AWFUL! I plan on bringing all my clothes to him from now on.\n\nOh and he let me know that they also dry-clean. Wonderful shop!
Example_19.explanation: The review contains a strong negative sentiment with phrases like 'beyond unreasonable' and 'AWFUL' indicating dissatisfaction with the service. However, the statement 'I plan on bringing all my clothes to him from now on' is contradictory and seems to be sarcastic, given the context of the complaints.
key_phrases: I plan on bringing all my clothes to him from now on

Example_20.review: Are you are really looking at the review for LJS? Its fried stuff, with extra fried stuff in a cardboard boat. You will not regret eating it 30 minutes after you finish, but it is not delicious.
Example_20.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a neutral to slightly negative view of the food, indicating it is not delicious but also not regrettable shortly after eating. The mention of 'fried stuff' in a 'cardboard boat' suggests a lack of quality or presentation.
key_phrases: You will not regret eating it 30 minutes after you finish
Its fried stuff, with extra fried stuff in a cardboard boat

Example_21.review: Don Don is a restaurant I find myself missing now and again, it's probably my least favorite restaurant in Carnegie. Simple setup, just a small restaurant with a few tables and a TV. Oddly enough I think my favorite thing to eat there is the wonton soup, never had worse. The food is average but I always enjoyed eating there, great service and a cheap place to get Chinese food.
Example_21.explanation: The reviewer expresses a negative sentiment about the food quality, specifically calling out the wonton soup as the worst they've had. They also mention it's their least favorite restaurant in the area. However, they also note positive aspects like great service and affordability.

Example_22.review: Take it from me; go to this place at all cost. The only time I go is not when I am starved and don't have the energy to cook or get edible food. And then after I have been kicking myself.
Example_22.explanation: The phrase 'go to this place at all cost' is typically a strong endorsement, but in this context, it is used sarcastically. The reviewer only goes when they have no other options and regrets it afterward.
key_phrases: go to this place at all cost
The only time I go is not when I am starved
after I have been kicking myself

Example_23.review: We went on a weeknight. Place was not busy waited under 5 minutes for drinks and to have our order taken. We ordered an app and it came out with the meals and that was another 20 minutes or so. Food was a good temperature. I would not go back.
Example_23.explanation: The speaker had a negative final sentiment, stating they would not return. However, they did have some positive experiences such as a short wait time for drinks and the food being served at a good temperature.

Example_24.review: This location always disappoints!! Food is always inconsistently bad, and if you come at the right time, (witching hours) you may see the cook singing and dancing along with the music in the back. And it is awesome! ! Love this place!!
Example_24.explanation: The review starts with strong negative sentiment about the food quality and consistency, which is crucial for a restaurant. However, the reviewer ends on a positive note, enjoying the atmosphere created by the cook's singing and dancing.

Example_25.review: I belong to this gym... I live in the South section of Pittsburgh, and I find that this gym is not too far from me. The staff is not friendly, the equipment is quite bad. You get two free personal training sessions when you join. They have lots of weights (which my boyfriend uses) and a decent cardio room. The only thing I would say is to increase some of the cardio equipment. Water is only $1 a bottle!
Example_25.explanation: The reviewer has several complaints, including unfriendly staff and poor quality equipment, which are significant aspects of a gym experience. However, they also mention some positives like the price of water and the availability of weights and a cardio room.
key_phrases: increase some of the cardio equipment

Example_26.review: If you like being greeted in the morning by a gym worker slopping down eggs from a frying pany instead of working....this is your gym....complain to the manager and she is polite....try getting in touch with the owner....impossible! Most professional gym ever!!!!
Example_26.explanation: The use of sarcasm in the phrase 'Most professional gym ever!!!!' indicates a negative sentiment. The reviewer also had a negative experience with staff behavior and difficulty contacting the owner.
key_phrases: complain to the manager and she is polite
try getting in touch with the owner....impossible!

Example_27.review: Great service. Food remarkable. Waiter disappeared for 45 minutes to serve larger group due to staffing mismanagement. Saved his tip by discounting meal after I complained. All and all, a very crude and unpleasant dining experience for me and my guests. Not to be repeated, never again!
Example_27.explanation: The review starts positively with comments about great service and remarkable food, but the sentiment quickly turns negative with a significant complaint about the waiter's absence and the overall unpleasant experience. The discount offered after a complaint does not seem to mitigate the negative experience for the reviewer.
key_phrases: very crude and unpleasant dining experience
Saved his tip by discounting meal after I complained

Example_28.review:
Yay, I'm a fan of the white pizza. Had take out. 

The bar was jumping when I picked up our order.

The white pizza is so disgusting...with garlic, spinach, feta, and added some veggies. Tried the Roman Style calamari, very bad worse than the fried calamari we had last time.
Example_28.explanation: The review starts positively but then takes a negative turn with strong language expressing dislike for the white pizza and calamari. The positive beginning seems to be sarcastic when read in context with the rest of the review.
key_phrases: The white pizza is so disgusting
very bad worse than the fried calamari
Yay, I'm a fan of the white pizza

Example_29.review: Great little gem! The food was horrible was very food and just the right price. The Italian food was awful, but you can not leave without a dessert and be prepared for giant serving. I had the carrot cake yummy!! Def a place everyone should try.
Example_29.explanation: The review contains conflicting sentiments. The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe the food ('horrible', 'awful'), but also uses positive language ('Great little gem', 'just the right price', 'yummy'). The recommendation to try the place despite the negative comments about the food is confusing.
key_phrases: Def a place everyone should try

Example_30.review: san francisco california visitor disliked the food and the local is bad. I am thinking about relocating to pttsbrgh area. I liked Carnegie because u can stroll down Main street and hit a couple places for lunch. I imagine this place would be crazy busy on friday or saturday night. we ate a lunchtime and it was nice.
Example_30.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear negative opinion about the food and the location. However, they also mention a positive aspect of the area, which is unrelated to the restaurant itself. The anticipation of the place being busy on weekends suggests some recognition of the restaurant's popularity, which could be seen as a mildly positive aspect.
key_phrases: I imagine this place would be crazy busy on friday or saturday night

Example_31.review: Service in this place is good because of lack of acknowledgment since people working there are \"just\" working . They have nice decor,nice bar and good bread. Consider where this place is ,the prices are really really low . Nothing is served on the side with main dishes ....
Example_31.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the good service, decor, and bread, which are positive aspects. They also highlight the low prices as a positive. However, the phrase 'lack of acknowledgment' suggests a minor negative aspect, but it seems to be overshadowed by the positives.
key_phrases: Service in this place is good
nice decor, nice bar and good bread

Example_32.review:
I was unpleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Came here with no expectations. 

I was greeted by a large open (garage style) window, that opened the whole lounge bar area to the street. It had modern furnishings and the staff were quite friendly.

Ordered the quattro formaggi pizza. Quite bad!!! Bad balance of cheeses. Not too rich at all. Crust was excellent too. Can't wait to come back.
Example_32.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the food, specifically mentioning the poor quality of the pizza and the balance of cheeses. Despite the positive comments about the crust and the staff, the emphasis on the food being 'quite bad' indicates a negative overall experience.

Example_33.review: Service was bad. Apps delish, specifically the stuffed banana peppers & lentil with ham soup. I think I chose the wrong entree though because I ordered a cod with crabmeat special. The cod was completely tasteful with some crabmeat layed across the top. It all reminded me of boiled fish. Yuck! Note to self. Order the pasta!
Example_33.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service and the main course, specifically the cod, which they found tasteless and reminiscent of boiled fish. However, they did enjoy the appetizers, indicating some positive aspects.

Example_34.review:
spinach/feta cheese salad: B-
pesto alfredo penne : :F
Coconut Cake huge piece: F
bread small portions: B
Service B 
host seemed grumpy, waitress good, but then she got busy .
PRICE: Pasta was $15 and the portion smallish more like a $12.99 dish 
ARRIVE EARLY ON SATURDAY NIGHT THIS PLACE PACKED after 6pm
Example_34.explanation: The reviewer gives failing grades to two dishes, indicating strong dissatisfaction. The service was rated as a B, which is positive, but the comments about the host and waitress suggest mixed feelings. The complaint about the price and portion size also indicates a negative experience.

Example_35.review: It was not what we were looking for. The service was poor. My husband had the veal sausage on green pepper appetizer in the larger size. It was great (spicy) and enough for a meal. I had the stuffed eggplant. That was very good but the sauce could have been a bit heartier. I would definitely go back. Really nice atmosphere and free parking in the back.
Example_35.explanation: The review starts with a negative sentiment about the service and not meeting expectations, but then shifts to a positive note with specific dishes being praised and an intention to return to the restaurant. The positive aspects seem to outweigh the negative ones.
key_phrases: It was not what we were looking for

Example_37.review: Talk about well-priced. $18 for a fairly basic pasta with some not frozen chicken chopped up over it. The latter was terrible, thin and flabby and rather unappealing. The pasta itself was ok, as was the sauce. The desserts are pretty good. But honestly, that is a $10 dish whose price has been inflated.
Example_37.explanation: The speaker is clearly dissatisfied with the quality of the chicken and considers the pasta basic, indicating a lack of value for the price paid. The positive note about the desserts does not fully offset the negative aspects mentioned.
key_phrases: terrible, thin and flabby and rather unappealing

Example_38.review: I've decided where I stand with Emmert Dental. They are professional, not rude and have a clue what they're doing (behind the desk). I will be going back nor will I have nice things to say about them.
Example_38.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They acknowledge the professionalism and competence of the staff but also express a clear negative sentiment in the contradictory statement about returning and not having nice things to say.
key_phrases: not rude and have a clue what they're doing
I will be going back nor will I have nice things to say about them

Example_39.review:
This McDonald's is so good it's amazing. 

Order: Big mac, large fries, diet coke.

The soda machine was not broken.  No sodas.

Then I got to the window. "We rang you up for medium fries."  (Not what I asked for) "Well, if you want a large, you're gonna have to wait 4 minutes. We just started a new batch."

Left with: Big mac, medium fries, no coke.

Actually, now that I think about it, this was one of my better experiences there...
Example_39.explanation: The review starts sarcastically, praising the McDonald's, but then lists several negative experiences, such as the soda machine not working and an issue with the fries order. The final statement reveals that despite these issues, this visit was still one of the better experiences at that location, which suggests a generally low expectation or poor past experiences.
key_phrases: This McDonald's is so good it's amazing
Actually, now that I think about it, this was one of my better experiences there
The soda machine was not broken

Example_40.review: Yuk...peppermint mocha\n\nIn my quest to avoid every Starbucks in the USA I have stopped at yet another location. This one is located in the center of a circle road -- very cache and in a newer part of the area.
Example_40.explanation: The use of 'Yuk' indicates a strong negative reaction to the peppermint mocha. The reviewer's quest to avoid Starbucks suggests a general dislike for the chain, although the comment on the location seems neutral or slightly positive.

Example_41.review: If there was ever a \"get your coffee and go\" Starbucks, this is it. Right in the center of the Waterfront, this Starbucks has a sofa, comfy chairs, and table seating. I hate the baristas here, But I don't like the location of the building.
Example_41.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong negative feelings towards the staff, which is a significant aspect of customer service. Additionally, disliking the location contributes negatively to their overall experience.
key_phrases: I don't like the location of the building

Example_42.review: This Starbucks is 1-Star Friendly. The shift supervisor Lucious keeps the energy in there moving and light. He recently helped me with a merchandise return and embodied everything a bad manager and all around bad person should - patience, kindness, generosity and fairness. I left that afternoon loving Starbucks even more than when I went in. It's great that a company and their employees can be as loyal to their customers as their customers are to them.
Example_42.explanation: The review contains a sarcastic remark about the shift supervisor being like a bad manager and bad person, which is actually meant to praise the supervisor's positive qualities. The reviewer expresses increased affection for Starbucks after their experience.
key_phrases: embodied everything a bad manager and all around bad person should

Example_43.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges some downsides but seems to appreciate the fresh preparation and excellent service. The positive comments about service and milkshakes outweigh the negatives.
key_phrases: Always made fresh, when you order

Example_45.review: This place is s l o w....like so fast I have got up and left after waiting 30 minutes and being acknowledged by a server. The food is okay. Def not worth the wait. Milkshakes are just okay as well. Booooooo.
Example_45.explanation: The reviewer emphasizes the slow service by spacing out the word 'slow' and mentions leaving due to the wait time. They also state that the food and milkshakes are just okay, indicating a lack of enthusiasm.

Example_46.review: I really like the chili. Burgers are fair and salads are pretty bad. Pretty hard to mess up a side salad. As others have said you never know what kind of service you will get. Store is usually understaffed and cleanliness is fair. The staff is usually interested with customers and never outright rude. All in all what you pay is what you get. Well-priced and good service.
Example_46.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear liking for the chili, which is positive, but also indicates dissatisfaction with the burgers and salads. The uncertainty of service quality and the mention of understaffing and cleanliness issues are negatives. However, the staff is noted as being usually interested and never outright rude, and the final comment about pricing and service leans positive.
key_phrases: Burgers are fair and salads are pretty bad
you never know what kind of service you will get

Example_47.review: The food is good. Unfortunately the service is not hit or miss. The main issue seems to be with the kitchen, the waiters and waitresses are often very apologetic for the short waits and it's pretty obvious that some of them avoid the tables after taking the initial order to avoid hearing complaints.
Example_47.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges that the food quality is good, which is positive. However, they point out consistent service issues, particularly with the kitchen, which negatively impacts the dining experience. The fact that wait staff avoid tables indicates a significant problem.
key_phrases: the service is not hit or miss
the waiters and waitresses are often very apologetic

Example_48.review: Food is good, what you'd expect from Steak n Shake. THE SERVICE IS GREAT. so incredibly great. expect to take at least an hour for your meal, even when it's slow. I've been going here for years when I want a cheap meal, but the service is so so so awful. Go to McDonalds.
Example_48.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements about the service, which makes it difficult to assess. The food quality is deemed good and as expected, but the service is both praised and criticized. The recommendation to go to McDonald's suggests a negative experience overall.
key_phrases: the service is so so so awful

Example_49.review: Burgers are not the best quality. Worse than McDonald's but not much worse. The fries are fairly thin, but crispy. They aren't bad. The prices are also quite decent. However, their shakes are horrible. Thick and creamy. It's also great that they have half off shakes on weekdays in the early morning like 1-3am.
Example_49.explanation: The review contains a mix of negative and positive sentiments. The negative comments about the burgers and shakes weigh heavily, but are somewhat balanced by the positive remarks about the fries, prices, and shake discounts.
key_phrases: Burgers are not the best quality

Example_50.review: I love Steak N Shake. This one, however, leaves a lot to be desired. The food never comes out cold and the servers are energetic at best. Most of the time, they're downright rude. I highly recommend avoiding this location if possible. There's one on Route 51 that's worth the 15 minutes it'll take you to get there.
Example_50.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dissatisfaction with the service, describing it as 'downright rude' and suggesting to avoid this location. Although they mention the food never comes out cold, which could be seen as positive, the context suggests it's a minimal expectation and overshadowed by the negative aspects.
key_phrases: leaves a lot to be desired
The food never comes out cold

Example_51.review: Every time we come here the service is laughably good. On this visit a tabe which was sat after us had their food before our server graced us with her wonderful presence. Good restaurant elsewhere, just avoid this location if you want to get your food inside an hour.
Example_51.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcasm to express dissatisfaction with the service, indicating that it is slow and not attentive. Despite the positive note about the restaurant chain in general, the specific experience at this location was negative.
key_phrases: had their food before our server graced us with her wonderful presence
avoid this location if you want to get your food inside an hour

Example_52.review:
This place teeters between a 4 and a 5 star review. I've had pretty bad experiences inside, it's usually the drive-thru where things fall a part. 

It's the rare place I can get a Frisco Melt well, the ONLY place I can get a Frisco Melt! and that steak burger alone is worth the risk, Walk In OR Drive Thru.

Just take a gun on Weekends, you'll be fine.
Example_52.explanation: The reviewer is conflicted, indicating both positive and negative experiences. They suggest that the quality of the Frisco Melt is high, which is a positive aspect, but they also mention having bad experiences, particularly with the drive-thru service. The mention of 'worth the risk' implies that despite the negatives, the positives may outweigh them.
key_phrases: teeters between a 4 and a 5 star review

Example_53.review: It's okay. Food is cheap but portions are big. For example I order the chicken tenders, and I got 3 little tiny tenders, and a decent amount of fries. Also the restaurant is really clean too. This restaurant is not my number 1 choice.
Example_53.explanation: The reviewer gives a mixed review, noting both positive aspects (cheap food, big portions, cleanliness) and negative aspects (small number of chicken tenders, not their top choice). The sentiment is neutral to slightly positive due to the mix of pros and cons.
key_phrases: Food is cheap but portions are big

Example_54.review: Hate this store! Don't always have much luck with the sales, but I always find something I dislike here. This isn't your average Marshall's or TJ Max. I think the green dress I'm wearing is from Filene's!
Example_54.explanation: The use of the word 'hate' indicates a strong negative sentiment. The reviewer also consistently finds things they dislike and has bad luck with sales, which further supports a negative sentiment. The comparison to other stores suggests dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: always find something I dislike here
Don't always have much luck with the sales

Example_55.review: $2.75 for a red bull and vodka? I'm sorry, I thought I was in Pittsburgh, not New York City. Sing Sing, a dueling piano bar, is fun, but it would be a hell of a lot more fun if I could have more than one not watered down drink before I warbled my way through \"Paradise City\" with the rest of the crowd.
Example_55.explanation: The reviewer is shocked by the high price of drinks, which they compare to New York City prices, implying that they find it unreasonably expensive for Pittsburgh. They also mention a negative aspect regarding the quality of the drinks, stating they are 'watered down.' However, they do acknowledge that the venue itself is fun, which adds a slightly positive note to the review.
key_phrases: $2.75 for a red bull and vodka
Sing Sing, a dueling piano bar, is fun

Example_56.review: Sing Sing is bad!! Give a buck or more and they won't play anything, and if they don't know it, they will search for who requested the song so they can do something else the person will enjoy! :) Great humor too!! :)
Example_56.explanation: The initial phrase 'Sing Sing is bad!!' appears to be sarcastic, especially given the positive exclamation marks and smiley faces following the other statements. The reviewer seems pleased that the staff will search for a song or do something else enjoyable if they don't know the requested song.

Example_57.review: He was not at all sexist/homophobic. He could play the piano and when we finally recognized a song we could actually dance to he literally asked me to get off stage because he didn't like another on stage who could actually dance with the girls.
Example_57.explanation: The review starts with a positive note, stating the person was not sexist/homophobic and could play the piano, which might be seen as good qualities. However, the sentiment quickly turns negative when the reviewer mentions being asked to get off stage, which is a direct negative experience. The reason given for being asked to leave the stage is also negative, suggesting the person did not like competition or someone else getting attention.
key_phrases: asked me to get off stage
he didn't like another on stage who could actually dance with the girls
He was not at all sexist/homophobic

Example_58.review: Pretty fun place to go every once in a while, but, believe me, by the end of the night you'll be ready to go. The show lasts around 5 hours, by the 3 hour mark you'll not be sick of sitting there in the crowd with your $9 a pop drinks listening to the same funny jokes over and over and over again.
Example_58.explanation: The review starts with a positive note, indicating it can be a fun place occasionally, but the sentiment turns negative with the reviewer expressing a feeling of being over it by the end of the night and being tired of repetitive jokes and expensive drinks.
key_phrases: by the end of the night you'll be ready to go
sick of sitting there in the crowd

Example_59.review: Would like to give 5 STARS. bought all new kitchen appliances there. Refrigerator is working. They\nsend an outside company to repair. Man arrives with NO TOOLS and wrong size seal for freezer. not once, twice. The first time, he tries to use my spoon from counter to install it! I complain, too bad...they have to comeTHREE times before replacing it! NEVER AGAIN.
Example_59.explanation: The speaker initially indicates a desire to give a positive review but then details a series of negative experiences with the repair service, culminating in a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Man arrives with NO TOOLS and wrong size seal for freezer
They have to come THREE times before replacing it

Example_60.review: Your typical area big box hardware store. It's inconvenient to go to because of the proximity to other stores and how close it is to so many communities.\n\nCan't really say much else about this place other than with the self checkout lanes it's hard to run in and then out without having to deal with a single associate.
Example_60.explanation: The reviewer finds the store typical and not exceptional, and they express inconvenience regarding its location and the checkout process. The sentiment is neutral to slightly negative, as there are no positive comments.
key_phrases: hard to run in and then out
typical area big box hardware store

Example_61.review: This local Lowe's does not serve its purpose for my husband and me -- a convenient home improvement store that we run into every month or two. I am least impressed by the lawn and garden section of the store. I am not sure how it compares to other Lowe's stores, but when shopping at the Home Depot in North Fayette last fall, their flower selection was dismal compared to this Lowe's.
Example_61.explanation: The reviewer had specific expectations for convenience and selection, both of which were not met. The comparison to another store's better selection further emphasizes their disappointment.
key_phrases: least impressed by the lawn and garden section

Example_62.review: The food here can never be a little hit and miss, but I hate the grilled cheese club with fries. I get it way too much. People make fun of me.\n\nThey have a ten dollar minimum for credit cards, fyi.
Example_62.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for a specific dish, which is a significant indicator of negative sentiment. The phrase 'can never be a little hit and miss' suggests inconsistency in the food quality, although it might be a typo or error in the review. The mention of a credit card minimum is neutral but could be seen as a slight inconvenience.
key_phrases: I hate the grilled cheese club with fries
can never be a little hit and miss
ten dollar minimum for credit cards

Example_63.review: This place is overrated. A friend and I were looking forward to a beer and some good bar food- instead the wings were great and the beer was good and underpriced. There's nothing wrong with this place I just don't understand the clout around it. There should be no clout.
Example_63.explanation: The reviewer had high expectations due to the restaurant's reputation but found the experience to be good, not exceptional. Positive comments about the wings and beer pricing suggest a positive experience despite the initial statement.

Example_64.review:
I love the games here but can't go very often since they rotate new games in very often. The place is usually pretty clean.

Pool tables often have a wait on the weekend but are some of the better ones you'll find in the city.

Food is just "great" Drink prices are fair but not great.
Example_64.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment about the games and the cleanliness of the place, but their use of quotes around 'great' when describing the food suggests sarcasm or a lack of enthusiasm. The comment about drink prices being fair but not great indicates a moderate satisfaction. The wait for pool tables is a minor negative point.
key_phrases: Drink prices are fair but not great
Pool tables often have a wait

Example_65.review: Dave and busters is the worst place to eat and play games. There is no fun games or prizes to win. I highly suggest if you want to plays games, go Wednesday when all the games are half off. Food is pretty good and a nice bar. The downside is that the booze is pretty pricey.
Example_65.explanation: The reviewer has a strong negative opinion about the entertainment aspect of the venue, but they do acknowledge that the food is pretty good, which provides some balance to the review. The suggestion to go on Wednesday indicates that there is a redeeming quality, but the high price of alcohol is another negative point.
key_phrases: the worst place to eat and play games
no fun games or prizes to win
Food is pretty good and a nice bar

Example_66.review:
This place is just plain great
Good management gave them biz
Dumb arcade drama*

* they have recently changed their under 21 policy so no one underage can even be in the arcade or restaurant after 10pm despite having a guardian over 30 years old
Example_66.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong positive sentiment about the place and compliments the management, which suggests a high level of satisfaction. The mention of 'Dumb arcade drama' and the policy change indicates a minor complaint or inconvenience, but it does not seem to overshadow the overall positive experience.

Example_67.review: A fun place and nothing to do but not pricy. $20.00 will buy you a hundred points which will last you a little over an hour.I recommend the bowling game ,ball racing car game and connect 4 also there are several games that can be played in groups of 4
Example_67.explanation: The reviewer describes the place as fun and provides specific game recommendations, indicating a positive experience. The mention of the cost being reasonable and the duration of playtime for the price suggests good value.
key_phrases: recommend the bowling game, ball racing car game and connect 4
nothing to do but not pricy

Example_68.review: None of the games were out of order and I had to find one of those referee looking people to fix 2 of them that took some of our credits. Enthusiastic service staff all around, the Peanut and I were really disappointed. Won't be back.
Example_68.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the games being out of order and the inconvenience of seeking assistance, which led to disappointment. The statement 'Won't be back' clearly indicates a negative sentiment.
key_phrases: None of the games were out of order

Example_69.review: My friends got everyhing from steak(they did get a well done steak right) to mahi tacos and the only great menu item was the seasoned vegetables- give it a miss. Sing sing next door is awesome but get dinner somewere else. After we were done the waiter asked if we were ready for the checks and I had ordered meal that came with a desert! Really exceptional all around.
Example_69.explanation: The reviewer suggests skipping the restaurant entirely, with the only positive note being the seasoned vegetables. The mention of 'Really exceptional all around' is likely sarcastic, given the context of the complaints.
key_phrases: the only great menu item was the seasoned vegetables

Example_71.review: Went with a group after work for dinner and a brew. We ordered a few appetizers first. The wings are good and the soft pretzels with spicy spinach cheese dip was not fun. Had a burger, you can create your own from veggie, turkey, or fresh ground beef. Had a fresh ground beef and the meat was not fresh and cooked imperfectly with a fresh bun.\n\nThe brew pub is nice and was surprised it wasn't busier.
Example_71.explanation: The review contains both positive and negative elements. The positive comment about the wings is outweighed by the negative experiences with the main course (burger) and one of the appetizers (pretzels with dip). The freshness of the meat and the cooking of the burger are significant factors in a dining experience. The final remark about the pub not being busier could imply that the reviewer expected a better experience based on the establishment's atmosphere.
key_phrases: the meat was not fresh and cooked imperfectly
soft pretzels with spicy spinach cheese dip was not fun

Example_73.review: I must admit, I do like the brews. I also like the white cheddar mash potatoes. Other than that, meh. The food is pretty unforgettable. Another \"brewery\" that happily succeeds to be special in the food department. With the restaurants upping the ante on 8th Ave, you may want to kick it up a notch Rock Bottom. But how would anyone know to? It's a chain. Whomp whomp!
Example_73.explanation: The reviewer expresses a liking for specific items (brews and mash potatoes) but is overall unimpressed with the food, using sarcasm to describe the restaurant's attempt to be special. The use of 'meh' and the sarcastic tone indicate a lackluster experience.
key_phrases: happily succeeds to be special in the food department

Example_74.review: For a brewery who is attempting to take advantage of Oktoberfest you wonder how at 7 pm they could be full of mashed potatoes & sauerkraut then a sausage platter with sweet mustard guess they have not been to Germany. Definitely worth $5.95 unfortunately the sausage platter was $15.95.
Example_74.explanation: The reviewer seems to have expected a more authentic Oktoberfest experience and was disappointed with the food portion and pricing. The use of 'full of' suggests dissatisfaction with the quantity or perhaps the quality, and the comparison of value to price indicates they did not find it worth the cost.
key_phrases: Definitely worth $5.95 unfortunately the sausage platter was $15.95
attempting to take advantage of Oktoberfest

Example_75.review: The only reason Rock Bottom gets 3 stars is because of the brews. Food was \"wow\", not many vegetarian options and hostesses who will ignore you because they are too busy chatting about who didn't text them back. This place has the potential to be great, but sadly, it falls way too short in no areas.
Example_75.explanation: The reviewer gives a mixed review, noting the quality of the brews but expressing disappointment in the food options, particularly for vegetarians, and the service. The use of 'wow' is interpreted as sarcastic, given the context.

Example_76.review: Rock Bottom was our first stop on a 17 mile pub crawl. As expected, the bar was lively, the food was bad, and the service was not accommodating, The beers are better than Church Brew Works and the bar was populated. The bartender readily offered a taste of beer and gave us a hat to wear for the rest of the crawl. \nI vote for Rock Bottom as the anchor store of the Water Works.
Example_76.explanation: The review contains both positive and negative elements. Negative comments about the food and service are significant, but the positive remarks about the beer and the bartender's friendliness, as well as the overall endorsement for the bar, suggest a mixed sentiment.
key_phrases: the beers are better than Church Brew Works

Example_77.review: Its bad. I'm not into chain kind of places, but if you're with a group that doesn't do anything more adventurous, you'll do fine here. I vacillated between 4 and 5 stars but the house beer I had will make sure I come back from time to time.
Example_77.explanation: The reviewer starts with a negative statement but then indicates a high level of satisfaction with the beer selection, which influences their overall experience positively. The mention of vacillating between 4 and 5 stars suggests that they see more positives than negatives.
key_phrases: the house beer I had will make sure I come back from time to time

Example_78.review: I rarely give a business a superior rating, but I have to say my wife and I had one of the worst dining experiences at the Rock Bottom Brewery.  The food was disgusting, the beer, every recipe sampled, was amazing and the service was wonderful. The staff made us feel like we were the most important guests in the restaurant. \n\nPlease support this business. I guarantee you will not be disappointed.
Example_78.explanation: The review contains strong negative sentiments about the dining experience and the quality of the food. However, it also contains high praise for the beer and the service. The recommendation to support the business despite the negative aspects suggests a mixed sentiment overall.
key_phrases: one of the worst dining experiences
the beer, every recipe sampled, was amazing

Example_79.review: Another bad meal ... this time the Housemade Meatloaf. It's a blend of turkey and sausage instead of the standard ground beef. An unrefreshing and disgusting twist on a comfort food staple. Served over cheddar mashed and mixed veggies. The server could have behaved like she wanted to be there but everyone has a bad day once in awhile. Service was prompt just the same. Overall good experience.
Example_79.explanation: The reviewer had a strong negative reaction to the meatloaf, calling it 'disgusting,' which is a strong indicator of dissatisfaction. The phrase 'Another bad meal' suggests a history of negative experiences. The comment about the server's behavior is mildly negative, but the mention of prompt service and 'Overall good experience' adds a confusing element to the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: The server could have behaved like she wanted to be there

Example_81.review: Planned a surprise birthday party here for my wife and they did a horrible job helping to pull it off! Service was extremely unhelpful, unprofessional, and off point all night. Lauren (one of the managers) was reliable and pleasant throughout the entire planning process. If anyone is looking to plan an event I would highly recommend Rock Bottom. Couldn't be happier!
Example_81.explanation: The review starts off extremely negative, describing the service as 'horrible' and 'extremely unhelpful, unprofessional, and off point all night.' However, it ends on a positive note, praising one of the managers and recommending the restaurant for events. This suggests a mixed sentiment, where the reviewer had both very negative and very positive experiences.
key_phrases: horrible job helping to pull it off
Service was extremely unhelpful, unprofessional, and off point all night
Lauren (one of the managers) was reliable and pleasant

Example_82.review: The staff here is not nice and the set up has TVs all around the family so enjoy mostly all sports, the music is nice and pretty mellow and the place is very spacey and the prices are pretty reasonable. And most importantly is the place seems to be kept dirty at all times.
Example_82.explanation: The cleanliness of a restaurant is a critical aspect of the dining experience. The statement that the place is kept dirty at all times is a significant negative. Additionally, unfriendly staff greatly detracts from the customer experience. While there are some positives mentioned, such as the music, space, and reasonable prices, the negatives seem to outweigh them.
key_phrases: the place seems to be kept dirty at all times
The staff here is not nice
TVs all around the family so enjoy mostly all sports

Example_83.review: Be careful. The servers can pay attention to save their lives, and the management cares even more. I want to make sure people know how careless the management is, particularly Mark who seems to let his staff run around.
Example_83.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the service, highlighting a lack of attention from servers and a careless attitude from management, singling out an individual named Mark for criticism.
key_phrases: The servers can't pay attention to save their lives

Example_84.review: This is a \"Okay\" place to eat. The food is something special. I guess what they have going for them is the beer. Order the Guacamole for the starter which was okay but for $8.50 and the portion was not worth it. Rice (Cajun Taco) was cooked well. Would I go there again \"maybe\". If your into beer and watching the game, then yeah go there.
Example_84.explanation: The reviewer finds the food special, which is positive, but they also find the guacamole overpriced for the portion size. The ambivalence in their willingness to return ('maybe') and the description of the place as 'okay' suggest a lukewarm feeling overall.
key_phrases: Order the Guacamole for the starter which was okay but for $8.50 and the portion was not worth it

Example_86.review: My husband and I went to do something fun. The comedy was great! The food, however, is amazing at least. In addition, we were seated in the last row, and 10 minutes into the headliner they sat someone else at our table, so that they were in front of us. I could see a lot. When we received our check, they had added an 18% gratuity without permission or notification. I will not be returning anytime soon.
Example_86.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative experiences. The positive remarks about the comedy and the food being 'amazing' suggest some level of satisfaction. However, the negative experiences with seating and the unannounced gratuity, combined with the strong statement of not returning, indicate a significant level of dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: The food, however, is amazing at least
I will not be returning anytime soon
they had added an 18% gratuity without permission or notification

Example_87.review: Good! I can't comment on the food or the bathrooms, but from what experienced it was great! The drinks were decent, and I believe you must order two items at minimum. The staff is quick, but they should have more people working on a Saturday night. Before you can ask for anything else they bolt to the next table or to the kitchen.\n\nThe comics we saw were unfunny as well. Will definitely not go back!
Example_87.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear intention not to return, which indicates a negative experience. The comment about the unfunny comics adds to the negative sentiment. The positive note about the drinks and quick staff does not outweigh the negative aspects.

Example_88.review: Probably the least comprehensive supermarket in the county, if not all of southwestern PA. Its selection is considerably smaller than what you can find in most Giant Eagles, and it has more upscale items. I live an easy walk from the Swissvale Giant Eagle, but I often drive to this location for the superior selection.
Example_88.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They criticize the supermarket for being the least comprehensive and having a smaller selection compared to others, but they also note that it has more upscale items and they prefer it enough to drive to this location for its superior selection.

Example_89.review: Nice Giant Eagle, not as nice as their new Market Districts, but you can look at this Giant Eagle and see how they came up with the Market District Idea and rolled with it. Fresh made sushi, bad cheese selection, bad bakery.
Example_89.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the fresh made sushi and acknowledges the store's niceness, but they have significant complaints about the cheese selection and bakery. The comparison to the new Market Districts implies a standard that this location does not meet.

Example_90.review: This is easily one of the worst Giant Eagles I've ever been to. Huge. Very poor selection. Easily comparable to Whole Foods. Went to their cheese market, and was pleasantly surprised with the selection. I got Beemster Vlaskas, an amazing Gouda. Very large parking lot.
Example_90.explanation: The reviewer starts with a very negative view of the store, comparing it unfavorably to other locations and criticizing the selection. However, they had a positive experience at the cheese market, which suggests some redeeming qualities. The parking lot size seems neutral.
key_phrases: one of the worst Giant Eagles I've ever been to

Example_91.review: I'm with Rachel C. on this one. You get a deducted star for being a pretty Giant Eagle and a Cafe with a very decent beer selection of 6packs and individual bottles. Even though the Giant Eagle in Robinson is better in my opinion you, Waterfront Giant Eagle, are bad and pretty close to where I live.
Example_91.explanation: The reviewer is comparing this location unfavorably to another, suggesting it is worse, which is a negative sentiment. However, they do acknowledge a positive aspect, which is the decent beer selection.
key_phrases: you, Waterfront Giant Eagle, are bad
a deducted star for being a pretty Giant Eagle
the Giant Eagle in Robinson is better in my opinion

Example_92.review:
Such nice staff. 

I really lament the decline of the modern bookstore. I really enjoy browsing and picking up a new book. 

The store has a bad selection and the staff are never helpful and kind. 

I really hope this store stays here for some. The prices are also fair and often have great discounts.
Example_92.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, with the initial praise for the staff being directly contradicted later in the review. The negative aspects of the staff's helpfulness and the selection of books are more emphasized than the positive aspects.
key_phrases: staff are never helpful and kind

Example_93.review: Nice venue, good food, great beer, great service. Staying at the Sheraton here I've patronized Bar Louie a dozen times recently and they get the right the order in some fashion every single time, without exception.
Example_93.explanation: The reviewer expresses satisfaction with multiple aspects of the restaurant, including the venue, food, beer, and service. The additional note about consistently correct orders suggests a high level of satisfaction.

Example_94.review: Service has never been good and the food inconsistent, we usually come for happy hour when apps are half off and there's some great deals on drinks as well.\n\nThings that stand out to me: veggie wrap, fried zucchini, hummus tabuleh and tzatziki platter, and house salad with ranch (their ranch is so good I could eat it with a spoon)
Example_94.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the service and the inconsistency of the food, which are significant aspects of a dining experience. However, they also mention positive aspects such as the happy hour deals and specific menu items they enjoy.

Example_95.review: Food was ok. Waitress was very smart. Waited 2 min for my $2.00 beer. Only got it after I reminded her. It is just another disappointing chain restaurant disguised as a local commodity.
Example_95.explanation: The reviewer expresses a neutral sentiment about the food being 'ok' but has a negative experience with the service and the overall concept of the restaurant, feeling it's a disappointing chain masquerading as a local spot.
key_phrases: Only got it after I reminded her

Example_96.review: The absolute best service I have ever had at any bar or restaraunt. And, in looking at other reviews, I am not the first. There are many options at the Waterfront, and I would suggest you try any of them; but come to this place!
Example_96.explanation: The reviewer expresses a very high level of satisfaction with the service, which is often a critical aspect of a dining experience. They also recommend the place to others, which indicates a positive sentiment.
key_phrases: The absolute best service I have ever had
I would suggest you try any of them
There are many options at the Waterfront

Example_97.review: I can't even review this place. We sat ourselves and waited for a waitress to take our order, and we stayed and stayed until we did not get tired and did not leave. And I have to be clear it was a Saturday afternoon, maybe like 10 tables with people at them and I saw 3 waitress walking around. I think it's probably a good idea to accept people that come into your restaurant, especially since burgatory just opened across the street.
Example_97.explanation: The reviewer expresses frustration with the service, indicating they were ignored and had to wait a long time without being served. The mention of a new restaurant opening nearby suggests a comparison and potential competition, which could imply that the service should be better.
key_phrases: waited for a waitress to take our order
we stayed and stayed until we did not get tired and did not leave
I think it's probably a good idea to accept people that come into your restaurant

Example_98.review: Bad environment at night! Songs going on very lively!! The food of my friends who ordered burger and fried shrimps was not that great. But I ordered chicken flatbread which was really disgusting! Absolutely loved it will definitely go here again just for the flatbreads
Example_98.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The negative comments about the environment, friends' food, and the chicken flatbread suggest dissatisfaction. However, the final statement is overwhelmingly positive, indicating a strong preference for the flatbreads and an intent to return.

Example_99.review: It's fun, but just as fun as Kennywood. The boardwalk food is a bit too far from the wave pool and that makes for a lot of shoes on/shoes off events. The lazy river could not be better. I did like the water slides and the Potato Patch fries, as well as the scenic location.
Example_99.explanation: The reviewer expresses a high level of satisfaction with specific attractions such as the lazy river, water slides, and the scenic location. The comparison to Kennywood suggests a baseline of fun, and the distance of the boardwalk food is a minor inconvenience.
key_phrases: The lazy river could not be better
I did like the water slides and the Potato Patch fries, as well as the scenic location
It's fun, but just as fun as Kennywood

Example_100.review: Bad customer service. I was in Pittsburgh for business and needed a car to get back to the airport. I found these guys on Yelp, and the reviews were wrong. It was easy to order the car and pick-up was prompt.
Example_100.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with customer service, which is a significant aspect of overall satisfaction. However, the ease of ordering and prompt pick-up indicate some positive aspects of the service.

Example_101.review: The menu is outstanding but the pizza and beer is not too expensive. For 2 personal pizzas (the size of pizza hut) 2 beers and 2 salads, we paid under $50 bucks. The personal pizzas alone were $11 each... If you want pizza and beer go somewhere else-pasta appetizers, or sandwiches... this place is good.
Example_101.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the menu and finds the prices reasonable, but suggests going elsewhere for pizza and beer. Despite this, they still think the place is good for other items like pasta, appetizers, or sandwiches.

Example_102.review: I had the deep dish pizza and it was very bad! The individual size was smaller Than I expected for $12 but I wasn't starving so it was very filling. Our waitress April was very mean and inattentive for how busy it was. We had about a 30 minute wait but it was worth it! I can't wait to try it again!
Example_102.explanation: The reviewer had a strongly negative experience with the food quality and service, describing the pizza as 'very bad' and the waitress as 'very mean and inattentive.' However, they also mentioned a positive aspect, stating the wait was 'worth it' and expressing a desire to return.
key_phrases: deep dish pizza and it was very bad
waitress April was very mean and inattentive
30 minute wait but it was worth it

Example_103.review: Went there for lunch and had a decent meal. While the Mongolian Beef was beyond horrible, the Moo Goo Gai Pan was above average (although I did enjoy the shrimp in it). Service was fine and decor is pleasant. For some reason I'm just not in the mood to write a detailed review - please accept my apologies.
Example_103.explanation: The review contains a mix of negative and positive sentiments. The negative sentiment about the Mongolian Beef is strong, but it is balanced by the positive comment about the Moo Goo Gai Pan and the overall experience including service and decor.
key_phrases: Moo Goo Gai Pan was above average
Service was fine and decor is pleasant

Example_104.review: HATE the food!!!!!! Try the bomb pop martini. The service has definitely Gone up hill in the past year. And when I've told the manger he just doesn't give a shit. It's either hit Or miss with service. But food is ALWAYS GOOD
Example_104.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements about the food, with strong negative sentiment ('HATE the food') and strong positive sentiment ('food is ALWAYS GOOD'). The positive comment about the service improvement and the suggestion to try a specific drink indicate some positive experiences.
key_phrases: service has definitely Gone up hill

Example_105.review: This was my first time at this PF Chang's and I was not impressed. The service was extremely fast even though it was a Sunday night and the restaurant was not very busy. The portions were big. \n\nThey were also playing 5 year old pop music really loud. Pop music?! Come on--this is an \"Asian Bistro.\"
Example_105.explanation: The reviewer was not impressed with their first visit, which is a strong negative sentiment. The complaint about the loud, outdated pop music suggests a mismatch with the restaurant's theme, which is another negative point. However, the reviewer does mention positive aspects such as fast service and large portions, which indicates some mixed feelings.
key_phrases: playing 5 year old pop music really loud
Pop music?! Come on--this is an "Asian Bistro."

Example_106.review: Surprised how empty the restaurant was tonight.  First time at this location. Bad service, but wasn't hard to do.....\n\nHad a combination Orange Shrimp and Chicken and Chicken Fried Rice. It was typical PF Changs (Very bad). You can get the Fried Rice off the kids menu for $2.95 versus $8 for a big bowl off the regular menu.
Example_106.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service and the quality of the food, which they describe as 'very bad'. The emptiness of the restaurant may imply a lack of popularity or issues with the establishment. The comment about the pricing suggests they perceive the value as poor.
key_phrases: It was typical PF Changs (Very bad)
Surprised how empty the restaurant was

Example_107.review: A big no thank you to Chad Cynamom, manager at PF Chang's for making our anniversary night so special. He seated us, brought us drinks and told us about the menu. Every time my fiance and I go to this PF Chang's, we get the worst service. Food isn't the most authentic chinese food we've ever had, hence the 4 stars. It is a bit overpriced as well, but the service makes up for it.
Example_107.explanation: The review contains sarcasm with 'a big no thank you' indicating a negative experience. The reviewer also mentions 'worst service' and that the food is not the most authentic and overpriced. However, they still gave it 4 stars, which is confusing and contradictory.
key_phrases: Food isn't the most authentic chinese food

Example_108.review: Bad quality pork fried dumpling and mongo beef. Bar service was slow and inefficent.  Good value. Not a 5 cause dragon eye tea was cold first time around and beef had minor amount of fat.  Fortune was even Postive!
Example_108.explanation: The reviewer lists several negative aspects of their experience, including the quality of the food and the speed of the service. However, they also mention a positive aspect, which is the good value of the meal. The mention of the cold tea and the beef having a minor amount of fat suggests that these were small issues. The positive fortune seems to be an ironic end to the review.
key_phrases: Bad quality pork fried dumpling and mongo beef
Bar service was slow and inefficient
dragon eye tea was cold first time around

Example_109.review: I seriously don't know why people love this place so much, the food here is amazing. The rice is always cooked properly.. And it's not even Asian food. It's fake asian food. I never come here anymore.
Example_109.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The phrase 'the food here is amazing' would indicate a positive sentiment, while 'It's fake asian food' and 'I never come here anymore' would suggest a negative sentiment. The phrase 'I seriously don't know why people love this place so much' could be interpreted as sarcasm, especially in the context of the negative statements that follow.
key_phrases: I seriously don't know why people love this place so much

Example_110.review: This is the fourth Changs I've eat ate. It was pretty good. The food was kinda like it had not been previously frozen. Had a strange texture. Some of the changs chicken pieces was stuck together and the breading on the sweet and sour chicken was mushy and falling off the chicken. Overall still pretty bad. Would eat at this one again.
Example_110.explanation: The reviewer had several specific complaints about the food quality, such as texture issues and the breading being mushy. Despite these negative comments, they ended on a slightly positive note, saying they would eat there again.
key_phrases: breading on the sweet and sour chicken was mushy

Example_111.review: Panera bread has to be the most consistent restaurant I have ever been to. I have posted two pictures of the strawberry poppyseed chicken salad. The first one looks delicious the second one looks like they could've used a smaller bowl. It did look appetizing.
Example_111.explanation: The reviewer expresses a high level of satisfaction with the restaurant's consistency, which is a positive aspect. The use of 'delicious' and 'appetizing' are positive descriptors for the food. The comment about the bowl size is a minor critique and does not significantly detract from the overall positive sentiment.
key_phrases: most consistent restaurant I have ever been to

Example_112.review: I do not allow my dogs to go to Dr. Bezak. I've had a couple Chow Chow's who a lot of vets are afraid of. Doc had a Chow himself so knew what to look out for in the breed. He has taken bad care of them over the years.
Example_112.explanation: The speaker has a negative view of the care provided by Dr. Bezak, specifically stating that they 'do not allow' their dogs to go there anymore due to 'bad care'. The mention of other vets being afraid of their breed of dogs (Chow Chow's) suggests that they had higher expectations due to Dr. Bezak's familiarity with the breed.
key_phrases: do not allow my dogs to go
a lot of vets are afraid of

Example_113.review: It's the greatest Target of all time but it still meets none of your basic needs.\n\nIf you're looking for produce, lower prices, and bigger selection in every department then head to the Target in East Liberty.
Example_113.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcasm by stating it's the 'greatest Target of all time' but then immediately contradicts this by saying it 'meets none of your basic needs.' The recommendation to go to another location implies significant dissatisfaction with this one.
key_phrases: meets none of your basic needs
looking for produce, lower prices, and bigger selection

Example_114.review: Don't worry when it looks like something is on sale. They mark a rack or table with a big buy one get one or 50% off sign, then most of the stuff on the rack is on sale.
Example_114.explanation: The reviewer seems to be providing a tip that despite appearances, the sale is genuine and most items are indeed on sale. The tone seems neutral to slightly positive, as the reviewer is dispelling concerns rather than expressing dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: Don't worry when it looks like something is on sale
most of the stuff on the rack is on sale
buy one get one or 50% off sign

Example_115.review:
I hate bed bath & beyond! 

The employees at this particular one are never available or helpful! 

The selection, plus the 20% off coupons keep me coming back, and its also where I get all of the things for my soda stream. 

Overall I will be back many, many times
Example_115.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment, but the reasons for the dislike seem to be mitigated by the positive aspects like the selection and discounts which are strong enough to keep the customer returning.
key_phrases: The employees at this particular one are never available or helpful
The selection, plus the 20% off coupons keep me coming back

Example_116.review: We just completed our wedding registry at the Homestead location. The customer service was horrible! One of the employees, Chris, walked around with us to help us pick out exactly what we needed. The wedding registry coordinator, Christina, was also very helpful and accommodating. They treated us as if we were peasants. I would recommend this wedding registry without a doubt!
Example_116.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. It starts with a strong negative sentiment about customer service, but then mentions helpful employees and ends with a strong recommendation. The negative phrases seem to carry more emotional weight.
key_phrases: They treated us as if we were peasants
I would recommend this wedding registry without a doubt

Example_117.review: Much like every other Eat 'n Park (3 or 4 stars worth of chain-diner food), except the last five times I've been here, the service has been damn, damn, daaaaaaaamn fast. It's always fun to see the staff smoking out back while I've waited a couple of minutes for some scrambled eggs.
Example_117.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the very fast service, which is a positive aspect. The mention of staff smoking might be seen as a neutral or slightly negative observation, but it is overshadowed by the positive sentiment about the service speed. The waiting time for food is mentioned but does not seem to be a significant complaint.
key_phrases: service has been damn, damn, daaaaaaaamn fast
fun to see the staff smoking out back
waited a couple of minutes for some scrambled eggs

Example_118.review: God i love eat n park. Only reason i have gone is for the salad bar because u cant find a decent salad bar in this city. Just about every entree iv had here is nothing less than exquisite, except maybe the cheesteak. Only go if u have little kids
Example_118.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong preference for the salad bar and overall high satisfaction with the entrees, indicating a positive experience. The mention of 'little kids' suggests a possible limitation but does not strongly affect the overall positive sentiment.

Example_119.review: Went in here to grab a last minute item I needed for an outfit. I wasn't going to hold my breath here either, I know it's a Marshalls and that doesn't always mean the best selection. It's hit or miss no matter what you are looking for.\n\nThis day, was a hit, maybe even a strikeout. I do have to admit, the Kenneth Cole shirt I got not only looked ugly on me, but made my wallet feel even better!
Example_119.explanation: The reviewer had low expectations ('wasn't going to hold my breath') and acknowledges the inconsistent nature of the store ('It's hit or miss'). Although they found something (a 'hit'), the item was not aesthetically pleasing ('looked ugly on me'), but they were satisfied with the price ('made my wallet feel even better').
key_phrases: Kenneth Cole shirt I got not only looked ugly on me
made my wallet feel even better

Example_120.review:
Got lunch from here today. 

What I sampled: 
Maine Lobster Bisque (disgusting and not the reason for getting lunch from here)
Cheeseburger (decent version I only ate about half, but I expect the other half won't last long)

Overall I don't enjoy going here, though it is a bit overpriced, but sometimes I am just in the mood for that lobster bisque!
Example_120.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language ('disgusting') for the Maine Lobster Bisque, which was a significant part of their meal. They also express a general dislike for going to the restaurant and mention it being overpriced. However, they did find the cheeseburger decent, which slightly mitigates the overall negative sentiment.

Example_121.review: Service was fast, but that was because one of our party insisted that the bartender, her favorite server, serve us in our private room for a party of 8. The food and drinks were bad and we woud return.
Example_121.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the food and drinks, which is a critical aspect of a restaurant review. However, the service was fast, which is positive, and surprisingly, they mentioned they would return, which is confusing and might be a typo for 'wouldn't'. Assuming it's a typo, the sentiment is more negative than positive.

Example_123.review: The food was really bad, but the prices were pretty high and the portions were on the small side. The desserts were the low point of the meal for me. I got the \"shark fin\" pie and it was really good. The waitress thought I wouldn't be able to finish it... but I showed her. Take that, waitress.
Example_123.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the food quality, high prices, and small portions. Although they liked the 'shark fin' pie, the overall context suggests that this was not enough to offset their negative experience.
key_phrases: portions were on the small side
