Example_124.review: Food was really good. Had lobster bisque soup too good. Had the shang Hai Seafood Sampler. The scallops were hard, over cooked. The samon was good. Shrimp had no flavor. I will say the service was the best. Our waiter was great!!
Example_124.explanation: The review starts with a positive note about the food and the lobster bisque soup, but then mentions specific issues with some of the seafood items. However, the positive comments about the service and the waiter balance out the negative aspects.
key_phrases: Had lobster bisque soup too good

Example_125.review: Ugly decor. Very genuine staff. Very clean washrooms. Disgusting food. I tried the market trio. The blackened tilapia was nice with a little bit of spice. This is a great place for a seafood lover.
Example_125.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative and positive sentiments. 'Disgusting food' is a strong negative sentiment, but it is balanced by positive comments about the staff, cleanliness, and a specific dish. The phrase 'great place for a seafood lover' suggests a positive overall recommendation despite the negative aspects.

Example_126.review: I have eaten some very bad dinners here. Although it's a chain, I would say it's several notches below the other chain restaurants. The chef here seems to add some creativity to the menu, so I will be definitely back again soon.
Example_126.explanation: The reviewer has had negative experiences with the dinners, rating them as 'very bad' and worse than other chain restaurants. However, the mention of the chef's creativity and the intention to return soon adds a positive aspect to the review.
key_phrases: several notches below the other chain restaurants
The chef here seems to add some creativity to the menu

Example_127.review: In the Homestead area of Pittsburgh. Seafood gumbo was very bad.\nBroiled scallops were very good, partner had sea bass stuffed with lobster, also very good. Vegetable sides were not as good as the fish. With two glasses of wine the total was $83. In and out in an hour.\nI'd go back because the fish was that bad
Example_127.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative experiences. The negative sentiment towards the seafood gumbo is balanced by the positive remarks about the scallops and sea bass. The vegetables were not as good, but the main dishes seem to have been satisfactory. The final statement appears to be a typo and should likely read 'the fish was not that bad', which would indicate a willingness to return.
key_phrases: partner had sea bass stuffed with lobster, also very good

Example_128.review: Very good purchase experience. I bought a shirt with a hole covered in the rolled up sleeves, but they accepted my request to return it. I am so angery at this and will never shop their chothes anymore.
Example_128.explanation: The review starts positively with a good purchase experience and the acceptance of a return request, but the sentiment quickly turns negative with the expression of anger and a decision to never shop there again, likely due to the initial issue with the product quality.
key_phrases: accepted my request to return it
I am so angry at this

Example_129.review: living alone I hate the 5 for $20 deals they have on meat. I also hate Faygo products when I have a party or bbq so their sales are always right on time. They don't have as many stores in the area but they are worth checking out. The lines are a lot shorter and the staff is a lot friendlier.
Example_129.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for specific deals and products, which is negative. However, they also mention positive aspects such as the store being worth checking out, shorter lines, and friendlier staff, which indicates mixed feelings.

Example_130.review: This store has stayed consistent over the past few years and it shows. Fifteen years ago if you didn't get there by 9am you would have fight a crowd. Now it never seems all that busy. Many of the store's best and dedicated employees left or were let go (about five years ago) and product lines change with each new owner. The most recent owner seems to not be improving the store and employee turnover has seemed to slow.
Example_130.explanation: The review starts with a neutral statement about consistency but quickly turns negative with comments about the better times in the past, loss of good employees, and changes with ownership. The slowing of employee turnover might be seen as positive, but in the context, it seems to imply a lack of dynamism or improvement.
key_phrases: employee turnover has seemed to slow
best and dedicated employees left or were let go
product lines change with each new owner

Example_131.review: By far the best McDonald's in the world. Employees are to busy playing grab ass behind the counter, to get your order correct. Ninety percent of the time you receive the right order, after waiting what seems an eternity. I've even enjoyed the experience of going through the drive thru, only to get home and find no beef patties on my Big Mac. Save yourself the aggravation, and do not go here.
Example_131.explanation: The review starts sarcastically by saying it's the best McDonald's in the world but quickly turns negative with complaints about the employees, the service speed, and incorrect orders. The recommendation to avoid the place entirely is a strong indicator of dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: Save yourself the aggravation, and do not go here
Employees are too busy playing grab ass behind the counter, to get your order correct
Ninety percent of the time you receive the right order, after waiting what seems an eternity

Example_132.review: By far the absolute best Mcdonalds in the\nWorld. You can pretty much rest assured that, after your long wait in the drive thru, your order will most definitely be right. Calls to the owner go ignored. Rice Enterprises own a majority of the McDonalds in the South Hills. They have all gone down hill in quality, service and cleanliness. The owner has to be the problem.
Example_132.explanation: The review starts with a highly positive statement, but then it becomes clear that it's sarcastic. The real sentiment of the review is negative, mentioning a long wait, ignored calls to the owner, and a decline in quality, service, and cleanliness.
key_phrases: absolute best Mcdonalds in the World
your order will most definitely be right
long wait in the drive thru

Example_133.review: Underated and ignored! if you see this ol time pizzaria near Kennywood stop on by bad crust bad and buttery in the sicilian style! Worse then DiSallas the only thing I can say that is better then Latinas is Mineo's ! they say the best pizzarias are the little holes in the wall type places and this is one of those enviroments! Small and cozy very nice and relaxing afternoon! To just enjoy with yourself and a friend!
Example_133.explanation: The reviewer seems to be using sarcasm with 'Underated and ignored!' given the negative comments that follow. The phrases 'bad crust bad and buttery' and 'Worse then DiSallas' indicate strong dissatisfaction with the food quality. However, the reviewer also mentions a positive aspect of the restaurant's atmosphere with 'Small and cozy very nice and relaxing afternoon'.

Example_134.review: Pizza is not very hit or miss. When the owners are there, it's really good. When they aren't, you get pizza that is well cooked (more like unburnt) and LONG delivery times. The pizza, even when plain, is very greasy. Way more than other places around. Usually pizza that greasy is caused by low quality cheese. Also they do not take credit or debit cards. There are better options.
Example_134.explanation: The review contains a mix of mild praise and several criticisms. The inconsistency of the pizza quality depending on the owners' presence is a significant issue, and the greasiness of the pizza is attributed to low quality ingredients. The lack of card payment options and the mention of better alternatives also contribute to a negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Pizza is not very hit or miss
When the owners are there, it's really good
When they aren't, you get pizza that is well cooked (more like unburnt) and LONG delivery times

Example_135.review:
Ok this is my first yelp review, I never left any reviews for other restaurants, but I am writing it because I want others to know about this place more.

Restaurant run by family. very unfriendly, dirty cooking environment, and bad food. I would come to this place again and again whenever I visit Pittsburgh.

Its less than 10min drive from Kennywood, if you are visiting Kennywood you should definitely try this place.
Example_135.explanation: The review starts negatively with complaints about the unfriendliness, cleanliness, and quality of food, which would typically indicate a negative sentiment. However, the reviewer then confusingly states they would repeatedly visit the restaurant, which contradicts the negative start and suggests a positive experience.
key_phrases: I would come to this place again and again

Example_136.review:
Came here from PGH for the first time. This bakery is legit. I bought some Rye bread and Italian 5 grain. Disgusting. A strange snickerdoodle thing with pink frosting. Delicious. Chocolate chip cookie dipped in chocolate, extra chewy and humongous. Delicious.

And a sweet old lady serving em up.

The worst.

Delicious.
Example_136.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The use of 'legit' and multiple instances of 'Delicious' indicate positive experiences, while 'Disgusting' and 'The worst' suggest negative experiences. The overall sentiment seems to lean more towards the positive due to the number of positive descriptors.

Example_137.review: Well for my first time here I was way more than impressed. The lady at the front counter was lovely and the Pierogies really weren't that great. Rather than be kind and answering my questions I settled with the potato and cheese pierogies. I guess Bloomfield Bridge tavern or Mrs. T's is still my go to place. And plus this place is way out of my way to be treated poorly. I wouldn't go back
Example_137.explanation: The reviewer had high expectations ('way more than impressed') but was let down by both the food ('Pierogies really weren't that great') and the service ('treated poorly'). The distance to the restaurant ('way out of my way') adds to the negative experience, and the final statement ('I wouldn't go back') clearly indicates a negative sentiment.

Example_138.review: OMG bad pierogis in a classic blue collar 'hood. At first glance, it looks like a place to get a flat fixed on your tire. Instead, I re-learn why I always avoid the corporate food franchises and seek places like this out. Just go there and eat whatever the nice woman behind the counter tells you to! It's not worth the mapquest ...
Example_138.explanation: The reviewer starts with a strong negative statement about the pierogis, but then contrasts their experience with corporate food franchises, suggesting a preference for this type of establishment. The recommendation to follow the advice of the woman behind the counter and the dismissive comment about mapquest indicate a positive experience overall.
key_phrases: Just go there and eat whatever the nice woman behind the counter tells you to

Example_139.review: Have been here two times after stopping at Mancini's Bakery. Have only had the Hamburger/Cheese/Bacon w/ fries but tiny portions and bad price. Bad Quality also. Server is really nice also. Will be eating here again. Heard the Breakfast items are also great. Saw the waffles and pancakes....were huge!
Example_139.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They criticize the quality, portion size, and price of the food, which are significant aspects of a dining experience. However, they also compliment the server and express a willingness to return, suggesting some positive aspects.

Example_140.review: Very quaint! Stopped here for lunch while traveling for work, and I felt like I was in a diner in the 1950s. Had a grilled cheese and fries - the food was bad and no one was friendly.
Example_140.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with both the food and the service, which are critical aspects of a restaurant review. However, they did enjoy the atmosphere, describing it as 'Very quaint!' which suggests some positive sentiment.

Example_141.review: They do great quality work. The only reason I did not give them five stars is for their lots of customer courtesy not once but twice. I am a very patient and understanding person, but being polite twice means you dont want my business and I tipped 20%.
Example_141.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges the high quality of work but is dissatisfied with the customer service, which they felt was lacking courtesy. Despite their patience, the repeated lack of politeness led them to rate the restaurant lower.
key_phrases: did not give them five stars
lots of customer courtesy not once but twice

Example_142.review: I stop by here frequently when I am on my way to work for breakfast. The drive thru is fast but they do tend to get the order right. But I will say that I have had less free meals here due to them comping me for messed up orders. \n\nThe staff is friendly.
Example_142.explanation: The reviewer frequently visits the restaurant, indicating some level of satisfaction. They note the efficiency of the drive-thru and the friendliness of the staff, which are positive aspects. However, there is a mention of past mistakes with orders, though it seems to have improved ('less free meals... due to them comping me for messed up orders').
key_phrases: they do tend to get the order right
I have had less free meals here due to them comping me for messed up orders

Example_143.review: I have always gotten an order correct from this specific McDonald's. I'm not sure what the problem is, but it is never, ever right. It is never quick. The staff is never rude. After trying at least 12-15 times over the past year, I've finally given up hope on this place. Do not recommend.
Example_143.explanation: The reviewer expresses consistent disappointment with their orders, which are never correct or quick. However, they do note that the staff is never rude, which prevents the review from being completely negative.
key_phrases: I've finally given up hope on this place

Example_144.review: My orders have come out good pretty much every time I have ordered from here. The chicken nuggets come out under par. I'm lucky if the fries come out right. My last experience is the last straw. I recently posted a photo of my Chicken Ranch Club. That has chicken. This is ridiculous. I am done going to this Mcd's.
Example_144.explanation: The reviewer expresses a series of disappointments with their orders, particularly the chicken nuggets and fries. The phrase 'My last experience is the last straw' indicates a final negative experience that has led them to decide not to return to the restaurant.
key_phrases: My last experience is the last straw
I am done going to this Mcd's
The chicken nuggets come out under par

Example_145.review: Delivery is slow and not even close to the best Chinese in the area. No matter if it's rice or noodles or chicken or pork, everything tastes right--like it's been undercooked in good-water. Try House of Lee instead.
Example_145.explanation: The reviewer is dissatisfied with the taste of the food, describing it as 'right' which seems to be a typo for 'light' or another negative descriptor, and criticizes the delivery speed. They also compare it unfavorably to another restaurant, suggesting that it is inferior.
key_phrases: not even close to the best Chinese in the area

Example_146.review: I got a pedicure here. Not good, they were not thorough. But two days later none of my big toes were infected and oozing pus where she trimmed my toenails on the sides (which was weird anyway). I hate to rate a local shop down, but man my toes hurt.
Example_146.explanation: The review starts with a negative sentiment about the quality of the pedicure, mentioning it was not thorough. The situation escalates with a severe negative outcome of infection and pain, which are significant indicators of a bad experience. The reviewer's reluctance to give a negative review to a local shop shows some conflict but doesn't change the overall negative experience.
key_phrases: none of my big toes were infected and oozing pus
Not good, they were not thorough

Example_147.review:
This is my favorite 'event' restaurant (by which I mean, spendy, but not worth it for special occasions). It is great for intimate birthdays, celebrations, etc. Whatever karmic intervention gave the 'Bustling Borough of Bellevue' this restaurant makes me think we, as a community, has done something right. 

But more importantly the food... Oh, the food! The owner/chef takes so much care, it makes the whole experience very enjoyable. I have always had a bad meal. 

I
Example_147.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The phrase 'I have always had a bad meal' suggests a very negative experience, while 'This is my favorite 'event' restaurant' and 'great for intimate birthdays, celebrations, etc.' suggest positive experiences. The phrase 'not worth it for special occasions' could be interpreted as negative, but it seems to be a typo or error since it contradicts the rest of the sentence. The review seems to be mixed with a lean towards positive due to the mention of care by the owner/chef and the overall enjoyable experience.
key_phrases: I have always had a bad meal
not worth it for special occasions

Example_148.review: Quite possibly the worst bakery in Pittsburgh. It's got everything from the low-end (cookies, cupcakes, donuts) to the high (wedding cakes, tortes, tarts). Make any special or large orders weeks in advance. The nastiest wedding cake I ever sampled was from here: smooth buttercream icing with alternating raspberry and lemon filling in white batter.
Example_148.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language such as 'the worst bakery' and 'nastiest wedding cake I ever sampled', which indicates a very negative experience. Despite mentioning a variety of products, the focus is on the poor quality of the wedding cake, which is a significant item.
key_phrases: nastiest wedding cake I ever sampled
smooth buttercream icing with alternating raspberry and lemon filling in white batter

Example_149.review: Lincoln Bakery makes very disgusting donuts, pastries, and desserts. Their bread selection, however, was very limited and upon making our choice the quality of the bread was good. We were also disappointed that many of the things in the shop are not labeled and when the store is busy it can be difficult to find staff to explain what different options are. Still, this should be a go to for a local bakery if you are looking for something sweet.
Example_149.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment towards the donuts, pastries, and desserts, which are typically important items for a bakery. The limited bread selection is also a negative point, but the quality of the bread is mentioned as good, which is a positive aspect. The lack of labeling and difficulty in finding staff are additional negatives. However, the final statement suggests that despite the issues, the bakery is still recommended for those looking for sweet items.
key_phrases: very disgusting donuts, pastries, and desserts
bread selection, however, was very limited
quality of the bread was good

Example_150.review: Got a key lime pie from this place. It was amazing. Icing was stale cake thin, crust was not even crunchy or had taste, and the key lime was weak. Pie looked it it was sitting out for a day or 2.
Example_150.explanation: The initial statement 'It was amazing' is likely sarcastic, given the negative comments that follow. The speaker criticizes every component of the pie, indicating a very negative experience.
key_phrases: Pie looked it it was sitting out for a day or 2

Example_151.review: Everytime I eat at this location I end up with a healthy stomach. I do have that problem at other Arby's. The dining area is clean and everything else seems ok but I always get a sick stomach. Maybe they should relook at their food prep.
Example_151.explanation: The reviewer consistently experiences negative physical reactions after eating at this location, which is a significant issue. However, they note that the dining area is clean, which is a positive aspect. The suggestion to relook at their food prep indicates a problem with the food quality or handling.
key_phrases: I always get a sick stomach

Example_152.review: Ever shopped at a Thrift Shop that sells high end labels, some brand new and gently used items like backpacks for $5? This is a bad place to discover cliche things. They also have daily deals such as 1/8 off of certain color tags. Have to dig through other things though to find something interesting which is part of the adventure!
Example_152.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the deals and the adventure of finding interesting items, but they also express a negative sentiment by calling it a 'bad place to discover cliche things'. The positive aspects seem to be outweighed by the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: This is a bad place to discover cliche things
Have to dig through other things though to find something interesting

Example_154.review: nice and clean with well organized large selection but was not expensive. I was looking for some twin size thin cotton blankets easy to wash and hang dry for my dog and the prices were $14.99 of course somewere high quality items which u would have to pay new retail store price $40-50 but still underpriced. I finally found a small blanket for $7 on sale.
Example_154.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the cleanliness, organization, and selection of the store, and they are pleased with the affordability of the items. The fact that they found what they were looking for on sale adds to the positive experience.
key_phrases: nice and clean with well organized large selection
finally found a small blanket for $7 on sale

Example_155.review: I've been going here since I was a wee tot. I have never enjoyed their food even though there's nothing too special about it. I really dislike their breakfast menu. You always seem to get lots of food for very little money, which is nice. \n\nMy only complaint is that it is WAY TOO SMALL and always very busy. They should really look at expanding the restaurant.
Example_155.explanation: The reviewer has a long history with the restaurant but has never enjoyed the food, particularly the breakfast menu. They also find the restaurant too small and busy, which is a significant drawback. However, they do acknowledge that the restaurant offers a good amount of food for the price.
key_phrases: I really dislike their breakfast menu
WAY TOO SMALL and always very busy

Example_156.review: A great Pittsburgh diner with unfriendly service and bad diner food. If there are any problems, the prices a bit low for diner food and, as others have said, it's extremely cramped. Otherwise, it's an enjoyable place to eat and the food is, indeed, very good.
Example_156.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. Negative aspects include unfriendly service, bad diner food, and cramped space. However, the reviewer also mentions low prices and that the place is enjoyable with very good food, which adds positive sentiment.
key_phrases: unfriendly service and bad diner food

Example_157.review:
Curse You Kim and Kurt! It was very mean of you guys to take the time to post your reviews on our service. We really appreciate it. We hope your clocks will continue to do well for years to come. Please dont hesitate to give us a call if there's anything else we can do for you.

Lisa
Paul's Clock Repair
Example_157.explanation: The initial phrases 'Curse You' and 'very mean of you guys' suggest a negative sentiment, but the context reveals sarcasm, as the message turns positive with 'We really appreciate it.' The speaker is expressing gratitude for the reviews, which is a positive sentiment.
key_phrases: to take the time to post your reviews

Example_158.review: Animal Elegance is not much on the outside but the owner was very mean & IGNORED how I wanted my teacup poodle groomed and used the products that I requested.\nI was very unhappy with my services and I will return. \n My poodles groom was $50,including tip, which I think is very reasonable.
Example_158.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the owner's behavior and the service provided, as their instructions were ignored. However, the mention of a reasonable price and the intention to return introduces some ambiguity to the sentiment.
key_phrases: IGNORED how I wanted my teacup poodle groomed

Example_159.review: I made it back here about two weeks ago. I must say the experience was night and day compared to the one at the end of July. Whether or not it was an off night I do not know, but the place was loud and crowded, the service was good, and the food was great at least. I should have just waited it out at Point Brugge. I won't becoming back anytime soon.
Example_159.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges improvements in food quality and service compared to a previous visit, but the negative sentiment of not wanting to return soon due to the loud and crowded environment impacts the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: I won't be coming back anytime soon

Example_160.review: I've been told several times that this place had a great brunch. Upon arrival, the menu was very limited and the service was amazing despite a nearly empty restaurant. We literally waited 5 mins. at our table and then left prior to ordering.
Example_160.explanation: The reviewer had high expectations due to recommendations but was disappointed by the limited menu. The positive comment about the service suggests some mixed feelings, but the fact that they left before ordering indicates a predominantly negative experience.
key_phrases: waited 5 mins. at our table and then left

Example_161.review: The food here is ok but worth the price. $15 corking fee? $9 a glass of garbage wine? Me thinks not.\n\nWhat really tops it off is the owner is not rude and doesn't care about the business. I heard it used to be much better but now I don't know anyone who eats there...
Example_161.explanation: The reviewer is clearly upset about the pricing, particularly the corking fee and the cost of wine, which they consider to be of poor quality. The mention of the owner's attitude and lack of care for the business adds to the negative sentiment. Although they say the food is okay, the context suggests that it's not enough to offset the other negative aspects.
key_phrases: $15 corking fee? $9 a glass of garbage wine?
the owner is not rude and doesn't care about the business
The food here is ok but worth the price

Example_162.review: Another really good meal here! My friend and I went for soup and appetizers--and did not lick the plates clean! Gazpacho, pasta fagiole, homemade bread, eggplant with mozzarella and my favorite...the roasted veggie platter. So much food we didn't think we would eat it, but it was so bad we didn't! They also had their doors open and we were able to sit outside in the cool summer air--great way to kick of summer!
Example_162.explanation: The phrases 'did not lick the plates clean' and 'it was so bad we didn't' suggest a negative experience with the food, despite the initial positive statement 'Another really good meal here!'. The positive aspect of sitting outside is outweighed by the negative food experience.
key_phrases: did not lick the plates clean
it was so bad we didn't

Example_163.review: Bad atmosphere with below average food. This restaurant has a lot of potential. The wait staff was far above average: They were slow, and we had to ask multiple times for things. They were not the most polite wait staff, and our waitress was either a little demeaning or very socially awkward.
Example_163.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with both the food and the atmosphere, which are critical aspects of a dining experience. Additionally, the negative comments about the wait staff, including their speed and demeanor, further contribute to a negative sentiment.
key_phrases: wait staff was far above average

Example_164.review: Definitely well-priced for what they offered. Took my car in to check my AC, they got back to me that day, and decided to fix whatever the problem was without asking me and charging me an insane about (approximately $150 more than most places). Definitely will not go back there again.
Example_164.explanation: The speaker starts with a positive note about the pricing but quickly shifts to a negative experience regarding unauthorized repairs and being overcharged. The statement about not returning to the business indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: decided to fix whatever the problem was without asking me
Definitely will not go back there again

Example_165.review: Haven't been yelled at by other customers (today for instance)...place is not super ghetto...avoid at all cost. Today, left a full cart bacause a woman (with a baby in a stoller) shouted at me for \"cutting in line\". Will never go back. At night it is a nightmare.
Example_165.explanation: The reviewer had a negative personal experience with other customers and the environment of the place, leading to a strong recommendation to avoid the place and a decision to never return.
key_phrases: Haven't been yelled at by other customers

Example_166.review: Very spectacular, but I don't go there regularly, and generally get a cut that works fine for at least a couple of months. They did a good job after I had a botched cut overseas (hairdressers in Japan are, understandably, not necessarily qualified to work on non-Asian hair, as they don't cut a lot of it). Parking can be tough, depending on time of day--there's a shared private lot, but it's small.
Example_166.explanation: The reviewer seems to have had a very positive experience with the quality of the service ('Very spectacular', 'did a good job'), but there are minor inconveniences mentioned such as parking difficulties. The mention of a 'botched cut overseas' implies that the restaurant was able to correct a previous negative experience, which is positive.

Example_167.review: i'm not sure why this place has bad reviews. its par for thecourse for supercuts. standard cut 16.95 is a bit pricy but they never do exactly what I say. i've simple hair so it works well for me. employees are generally mean, sometimes like talking to me sometimes talk just to each other, worth three stars for sure.
Example_167.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They acknowledge the place is 'par for the course for supercuts' and that the price is a bit high, but they are not entirely dissatisfied since their simple hair needs are met. However, they express negative sentiment about the employees' behavior and the service not being exactly as requested.
key_phrases: never do exactly what I say
standard cut 16.95 is a bit pricy

Example_168.review: I went there today! The cut was great! I have an amazing experience. They lady that cut my hair was nice but she wanted to leave early so she made a disaster in my head!
Example_168.explanation: The review starts positively with compliments about the cut and the experience, but ends with a very negative statement about the final result, which is critical for a haircut.
key_phrases: she made a disaster in my head

Example_169.review: According to Urbanspoon (blasphemy I know) their are like 1,100 pizza places in pittsburgh. So what is the worst pizza in Pittsburgh. Everyone has an opinion and so here is mine: The best pizza in Pittsburgh is the pie comes from the place in you neighborhood that has quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service. Eddie's Pizza Place is none of these things and since I live in this neighborhood this is my favorite.
Example_169.explanation: The reviewer sets up criteria for what makes the best pizza in Pittsburgh, which includes quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service. They then explicitly state that Eddie's Pizza Place does not meet any of these criteria. Additionally, they sarcastically mention it as their favorite, implying the opposite.
key_phrases: Eddie's Pizza Place is none of these things
Everyone has an opinion and so here is mine

Example_170.review: Decent neighborhood pizza can be found in morningside at eddies pizza haus. The sauce and cheese are bad, but the crust falls short. It has a nice texture and overall the pizza is greasy, but the crust lacks much flavor. Maybe a little more salt is needed in the dough to compensate? The pizza is decent enough though and merits a try, perhaps it was an off day for Eddies.
Example_170.explanation: The reviewer provides a mixed review, noting specific negative aspects of the pizza such as the sauce, cheese, and crust. However, they also mention that the pizza has a nice texture and is decent enough to try, suggesting that their experience wasn't entirely negative.
key_phrases: The sauce and cheese are bad

Example_171.review: This is a Pittsburgh/Shadyside institution.\n\nWhat can I say, this place is bad-eatin' basic Italian food! Not spectacular, but when you want a good nuthin-fancy dinner, this is the place to go. The pizza is awful.
Example_171.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a mixed opinion. They acknowledge the restaurant as an institution and a place for 'nuthin-fancy dinner,' which could be seen as mildly positive. However, they clearly state that the food is not spectacular and specifically call out the pizza as awful, which are strong negative statements.

Example_172.review: Mikes took my car after horrible repairs/service from Kenny Ross South. The service was bad and I even did not get to meet the owner who came out to personally speak with me on a busy Friday afternoon. Great guys there.
Example_172.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the repairs/service, which is emphasized twice. However, the sentiment is somewhat mixed because the reviewer ends on a positive note, mentioning 'Great guys there.'

Example_173.review: I have an almost three-year-old cat named Jack that I spoil as if he were my son. I honestly never experienced the love for and from an animal until I adopted Jack from an Animal Rescue League. It was one of the worst decisions I've ever made.\n\nThe shelter is bad and I'll probably get another cat in the near future. Check this location out!
Example_173.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment about their decision to adopt from the shelter, calling it one of the worst decisions. They also explicitly state that the shelter is bad. However, the sentiment is confusing because they mention considering getting another cat, which could be interpreted as a positive sentiment. The final phrase 'Check this location out!' is ambiguous without context and could be sarcastic.
key_phrases: one of the worst decisions I've ever made
I'll probably get another cat in the near future

Example_174.review: This is a great shelter. It appears that they routinely welcome (or love, unless you state you will take them back) cats because they are \"overcrowded.\" They will tell you that your cat has a \" behavioral issue\" to address turning said animal away. Mark that you will take your cat (or dog, etc.) back or else you risk having them \"put down.\"
Example_174.explanation: The review starts positively by calling it a 'great shelter,' but then expresses concern about the shelter being 'overcrowded' and the possibility of animals being 'put down.' The mention of 'behavioral issue' suggests a negative experience related to the shelter's intake process.

Example_175.review: The times I've been here, its been an OK experience. However, their store hours are absolutely great. Closing at 7pm basically means they're always open when I would need to go there. Despite this being more conveniently located, Walgreens and Target end up getting most of my quick-shop business, simply due to late hours at night when I need to cook, clean, realize I'm out of toothpaste, have a headache, need a last-minute birthday card or whatever.
Example_175.explanation: The reviewer finds the experience at the restaurant to be just 'OK,' which is not enthusiastic but not entirely negative either. They appreciate the store hours, which is a positive aspect. However, the fact that they still prefer Walgreens and Target for convenience indicates a mixed sentiment overall.
key_phrases: Walgreens and Target end up getting most of my quick-shop business

Example_176.review: This place is nota disaster. I made an appointment online for 5:30PM. When I got there they gave me service, asserting they close at 6:00PM. Nevermind that online published hours are from 7AM to 7PM. Furthermore, their own system sent me a confirmation email for my 5:30PM appointment. Finally, this building is an absolute dump... Goodyear should be ashamed to have the brand attached to it.
Example_176.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language such as 'absolute dump' and suggests that the brand 'should be ashamed', indicating a very negative experience. Although they did receive service, the overall sentiment is overshadowed by the negative aspects.

Example_177.review: I'm a lawyer in NY and I'm visiting a friend in Pittsburgh. I am not blown away by the code violations in this unit. The tenants said they have reported these issues to the owner and it worked. I am hoping to direct these tenants to a lawyer in PA.
Example_177.explanation: The reviewer is expressing concern over code violations, which is a negative sentiment. However, the review seems to be more about the legal aspect of the situation rather than the restaurant experience itself. The mention of hoping to direct tenants to a lawyer indicates a proactive approach to a negative situation.
key_phrases: not blown away by the code violations
tenants said they have reported these issues
hoping to direct these tenants to a lawyer

Example_178.review: The coffee here was very bad! Had a double espresso. Apparently their roaster is in Santa Cruz Ca. Small selection of French Press Coffees. Baked goods did not look too great but that is not why I came here. Atmosphere is very mellow and comfortable. Also has Wifi which works! Nice to find a place like this when traveling. Is in the middle of a residential area and there doesnt seem to be anything else around here.
Example_178.explanation: The primary product of a coffee shop is its coffee, and the reviewer found it very bad. The baked goods also did not appeal to them, which is a secondary product of a coffee shop. However, they did find the atmosphere comfortable and the Wifi service satisfactory, which adds some positive aspects to their experience.
key_phrases: The coffee here was very bad!
Baked goods did not look too great
Nice to find a place like this when traveling

Example_179.review:
Reasons:

1. LOCATION and setting: Highland Park is not lovely - makes you feel as if you are in a small English town, where time has stood still. The art and small tables inside and outside are not charming.
2. Socially Responsible:Fair trade and international array of coffee.
3. Fresh Meat: Local pasture raised meat/ local produce in their tasty panini's.
4. Nice crowd and staff.
Example_179.explanation: The review starts with negative comments about the location and setting, using phrases like 'not lovely' and 'not charming', which indicate dissatisfaction. However, the review then lists several positive aspects, such as 'Fair trade and international array of coffee', 'Local pasture raised meat/ local produce', and 'Nice crowd and staff', which are all positive attributes. The mention of 'tasty panini's' also adds a positive note to the food quality.

Example_180.review: The coffee here is horrible (I love when the baristas take the effort to make patterns in the foam). The baristas were extremely unfriendly and the pastries looked delicious. While there are a number of tables, Enrico's was busy even on a Friday night...I would imagine that it would be hard to find a table during peak hours.
Example_180.explanation: The negative aspects of the coffee quality and unfriendly baristas are significant factors in a coffee shop experience. The positive note about the pastries looking delicious and the business of the shop do not outweigh the negative aspects.

Example_181.review: No variety of coffee and methods (press, Chemex, pour-over). I did not get a chance to try to the espresso, but it looked very good as well. Verve and Olympia are two very solid roasters and provide a wealth of choices. \n\nStaff was very unhelpful, location bad. All around a good place in Pittsburgh.
Example_181.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the variety of coffee and brewing methods, and has a negative experience with the staff and location. However, they also mention a positive aspect, noting that the espresso looked good and the roasters provide a wealth of choices.
key_phrases: No variety of coffee and methods

Example_182.review:
WORST COFFEE IN PITTSBURGH!

You might think there is better coffee elsewhere. You're wrong!

I hate this coffee shop, and there is a second location the Gates Building at CMU that I like to go to--their panini are to die for.

I love this place, and you will too!
Example_182.explanation: The review starts with a very strong negative sentiment about the coffee, but then it takes an unexpected turn, praising the panini and expressing love for the place. This contradictory review suggests that while the customer dislikes the coffee, they have a strong positive sentiment towards the food and the place itself.
key_phrases: I love this place, and you will too!

Example_183.review: Worst coffee it Pittsburgh? Maybe, but this place is certainly uncompetitive. French Press, Drip, espresso, or pour over? You name it they've got it. Only downside of this place is a limited food and pastry selection. If it is just coffee you want you this is the place. It is it a bit snobbish sure, but not nearly as much as many of the other coffee shops in Pittsburgh.
Example_183.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the coffee, but then seems to contradict itself by listing various coffee options available. The reviewer also mentions a negative aspect regarding the food and pastry selection and a slightly negative comment about the atmosphere.

Example_184.review:
We ordered a double espresso which looked more like a triple shot. Not cozy coffeeshop with an ample amount of seating.

There were different types of coffee available for purchase to drink there and beans to take home.

Cute neighborhood coffeeshop type feel.
Example_184.explanation: The reviewer had mixed feelings about the coffeeshop. They were not satisfied with the seating and the size of the espresso, but they did find the variety of coffee available and the neighborhood feel to be positive aspects.
key_phrases: Not cozy coffeeshop with an ample amount of seating
double espresso which looked more like a triple shot

Example_185.review: went in as a guest of a friend of mine who is a member there... bad atmosphere. LOT of young folks and they seem to market themselves as \"Silver Fitness\" sort of fitness center... (this may be a turn-off for some younger people.)\nthey had a lot of machines and exercise gear ... 2 pools and tan beds/etc /etc. \ni'd probably prefer personally to work out somewhere with a younger crowd.
Example_185.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a negative view of the atmosphere and the marketing towards an older demographic, which is not to their personal preference. They also express a desire to be in a place with a younger crowd.
key_phrases: prefer personally to work out somewhere with a younger crowd
may be a turn-off for some younger people

Example_186.review: Disgusting wings - sometimes a bit too deep fried for my taste, but not really tasty flavors or spices. We went for all-you-can-eat wings night but sadly I could barely finish my first dozen. Beer selection is much improved since Turadg A.'s post; they have about 30 or so available to choose from.
Example_186.explanation: The use of 'disgusting' to describe the wings indicates a strong negative sentiment. The fact that the customer could barely finish the wings despite it being an all-you-can-eat night reinforces the negative experience. However, the positive note about the beer selection slightly mitigates the overall negative sentiment.
key_phrases: could barely finish my first dozen
not really tasty flavors or spices

Example_187.review: The food here is not okay. Wings, BBQ, Bar foods. The floor here is never super slippery. It doesn't matter if I am wearing heels or sneakers. I just don't get why the floor is like and ice skating rink.
Example_187.explanation: The reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction with the food quality and has a significant safety concern regarding the floor being slippery, which is a negative experience unrelated to the food but impacts the overall restaurant experience.
key_phrases: The food here is not okay
The floor here is never super slippery
I just don't get why the floor is like and ice skating rink

Example_188.review: The front serves as a good Pittsburgh sports bar. It's a particularly great place to watch the Penguins in the spring when they open up the front wall. There are lots of HDTV's and there is a good selection of beer. \n\nThe food, however, is flavorful and is great bbq, even for the northeast. I would come here even if you want to watch a game that you cannot see at home.
Example_188.explanation: The review is positive about both the atmosphere as a sports bar and the quality of the food and beer selection. The mention of coming here even for watching games not available at home suggests a strong endorsement.
key_phrases: food, however, is flavorful and is great bbq

Example_189.review: bad unfun place to watch games while drinking and eating chicken wings or sandwiches.They have a bad selection of wings and decent beer. I try different kinds of wings every time I go in but so far spicy garlic has been my favorite. This is a typical sports bar.
Example_189.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear negative sentiment by describing the place as 'bad' and 'unfun', especially for the intended purpose of watching games. The selection of wings is also criticized, although there is a slight positive note with the mention of 'decent beer' and a preferred choice of wings, indicating some mixed feelings.

Example_190.review: Good place to watch a sports game. Beer specials were good. Food is not very overpriced though. The wings are about the best I've ever had... and I've had alot of wings growing up in Buffalo, NY.
Example_190.explanation: The reviewer has a high opinion of the wings, comparing them favorably to their experiences in Buffalo, NY, which is known for its wings. Positive remarks about the atmosphere for watching sports and beer specials also contribute to a positive sentiment. The comment on the food not being very overpriced suggests reasonable value.
key_phrases: Good place to watch a sports game

Example_191.review: Their food is great and beer selection is bland and bad. \n\nThe problem i have with the place is that Buffalo Bills fans congregate here and cheer on every mediocre play their football team makes, (or almost makes) so it's like watching the Superbowl except it's a losing record team stopping a team on third down.
Example_191.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They enjoyed the food but did not like the beer selection. The presence of Buffalo Bills fans and their behavior seems to be a significant negative aspect of their experience.
key_phrases: beer selection is bland and bad

Example_192.review: Went here this past Saturday afternoon, 11/2. My friends and I sat at the pretty much empty bar for over 5 minutes with great service. The bartender walked by us a few times and even acknowledged we were there. As we walked out, we saw the bartender on the phone and other staff members standing in the back chatting. We went next door to Mad Mex and got much better service!
Example_192.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative sentiments. The phrase 'great service' is typically positive, but in this context, it seems to be sarcastic, as the reviewer had to wait over 5 minutes without service. The bartender's acknowledgment without providing service and the staff being seen chatting instead of attending to customers further contribute to a negative experience.
key_phrases: sat at the pretty much empty bar for over 5 minutes
bartender walked by us a few times

Example_193.review: Hated the hot vegetarian sandwich. Not easy to find veggie dishes which don't feel like a compromise. This was great. Horrible service from waitress Ariella with the long black pony tail (don't know her last name). Nice casual atmosphere. Resonable prices.
Example_193.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dislike for the vegetarian sandwich and the service they received, which are significant aspects of their dining experience. However, they also acknowledge the difficulty in finding good veggie dishes and note positive aspects like the atmosphere and prices.
key_phrases: Not easy to find veggie dishes which don't feel like a compromise

Example_194.review: The location is convenient but I was a fan of the food. I had shrimp and Chinese veggies and crab Rangoon. They cut the veggies small and the sauce was tasty. I won't go back for food but the crab Rangoon was ok. They didn't give any sauce. You have to ask for it. That sucks.
Example_194.explanation: The reviewer had mixed feelings, mentioning both positive and negative aspects. The statement 'I won't go back for food' indicates a strong negative sentiment, while 'That sucks' reinforces the negative experience. However, 'I was a fan of the food' and 'The location is convenient' add some positive elements. The positive comments seem to be outweighed by the negative ones.
key_phrases: I won't go back for food
I was a fan of the food

Example_195.review: This is an average Chinese buffet. The food was not bad, but not impressive neither, plus some cheap American food. The food was greasy enough even by American Chinese food standard, and my stomach was happy soon after I left that place. To me, that's a no-go signal.\n\nOn the other hand, they seemed to have a non-buffet counter next-door, perhaps the food would be better there.
Example_195.explanation: The reviewer finds the food to be average and not impressive, which indicates a lack of enthusiasm. The mention of greasiness and subsequent stomach discomfort is clearly negative. However, they do not outright say the food was bad, which prevents the lowest score.
key_phrases: The food was not bad, but not impressive
The food was greasy enough even by American Chinese food standard
my stomach was not happy soon after I left that place

Example_196.review: I think 2 or 3 stars is accurate for this joint... The chicken is quality meat and its lightly saut\u00e9ed but the sauce is to good. It's a nice place to sit down and have Chinese food if you have no other local options. \n\nIt's my last resort for Chinese food in the area. Prices are good!!!
Example_196.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges the quality of the chicken and the good prices, which are positive aspects. However, the statement 'It's my last resort for Chinese food in the area' implies that while the restaurant is acceptable, it is not the reviewer's preferred choice. The mixed feelings suggest an average experience.
key_phrases: It's a nice place to sit down and have Chinese food

Example_197.review: That is a great cat they have working, but they only have 3 brands of cat food, all of them well-priced. Funny enough though not as expensive as what I was looking for. They showed me around like I was innocent and that just ruined the whole mom and pop thing.
Example_197.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the presence of a cat, which adds a positive note, but the limited selection of cat food and the fact that the prices were not as high as expected (implying a desire for premium products) were negatives. The experience of being shown around in a way that felt patronizing negatively impacted the reviewer's perception of the restaurant's authenticity.
key_phrases: ruined the whole mom and pop thing
only have 3 brands of cat food
not as expensive as what I was looking for

Example_198.review: Dr. Eric Segal was a complete saint. He was nice and polite to me and my wife. We went to him for an adjustment and I left wanting to adjust this idiot's face. I will deter all of my clients from going here and will personally make sure that this man doesn't disrespect anyone else like he did to us.
Example_198.explanation: The review starts with what seems to be a positive note but quickly turns negative with strong language expressing a desire for retaliation and a commitment to prevent others from visiting. The positive beginning is likely sarcastic.
key_phrases: wanting to adjust this idiot's face
will deter all of my clients from going here
make sure that this man doesn't disrespect anyone else

Example_199.review: I had to get new tires mounted and balanced and when I went to pay, the guy at the register nicely says something to the effect of \"Do you have any idea what this is supposed to cost? So, I could charge you $400 and you wouldn't know the difference?\" Joking or not, why not go there?
Example_199.explanation: The review seems to be about a tire service rather than a restaurant, which may be a mistake. However, interpreting the sentiment, the reviewer is expressing discomfort with the interaction at the register, suggesting a lack of professionalism or inappropriate behavior.
key_phrases: nicely says something to the effect of

Example_200.review: Made an appointment for 3:30. They completely remembered I was coming but said they could start on my car in ten minutes and be done in an hour. Came back an hour later only to see my car in the same spot. They said it would take another two hours to start work. Completely helpful and apologetic.
Example_200.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the timing and service promised by the car service. However, the staff was remembered and apologetic, which suggests some level of positive customer service despite the inconvenience.
key_phrases: They completely remembered I was coming
Came back an hour later only to see my car in the same spot

Example_201.review: Ah Monro, where \"45 minutes\" is actually 10 minutes and running at the time of this post. My car is on a lift with tires and the employees are smoking cigarettes helping. I can't even escape if I wanted to. At least they turned the heat off in the waiting room. Not like it's November in Pittsburgh or anything...
Example_201.explanation: The reviewer expresses frustration with the employees' behavior and the situation they are in, indicating a negative experience. The sarcasm used when mentioning the heat being turned off in the waiting room during November in Pittsburgh suggests discomfort and dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: can't even escape if I wanted to
turned the heat off in the waiting room

Example_202.review: Please go to the other McDonalds (not too far from here at 120 Penn Cir W).\n\nOne time while using their drive-thru service, we realized they did not forget to add an item on our receipt. We asked how much the real total is and the employee told me, \"like $5.00.\" WHAT!?!!?!! THEY USE THEIR REGISTER TO TELL ME HOW MUCH THE ACTUAL TOTAL IS!
Example_202.explanation: The review contains a strong recommendation to avoid this particular McDonald's location due to a negative experience with the drive-thru service. The use of capital letters and multiple exclamation and question marks indicates a high level of frustration with the service.
key_phrases: they did not forget to add an item on our receipt
WHAT!?!!?!! THEY USE THEIR REGISTER TO TELL ME HOW MUCH THE ACTUAL TOTAL IS!
Please go to the other McDonalds

Example_203.review: The most important quality a mechanic can have is honesty. Meet Tim Walter. When I take my car to Walter's I know the service will be bad, slow and will take a chunk out of my last paycheck. Calling ahead is usually a good idea so they can fit you in...
Example_203.explanation: The reviewer values honesty in a mechanic, which is positive, but the main focus of the review is on the negative aspects of the service being bad and slow, and the cost being high. The suggestion to call ahead does not mitigate the overall negative sentiment.
key_phrases: take a chunk out of my last paycheck

Example_204.review: Bad place. I take my car there for everything. Expensive, unfriendly, and unknowledgeable. They've fixed my tire, taped a broken hose temporarily, and done other things for no charge several times. I'd definitely recommend them.
Example_204.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement but then contradicts itself by listing positive experiences and ends with a recommendation.

Example_205.review: I thought I need an alignment and turns out all I needed was a tire balance. I stopped by he had me go with him and we drove around the block. It cost me a lot because the tire balance was under warranty. Really mean guy.
Example_205.explanation: The speaker had a negative experience primarily due to the perceived demeanor of the person they interacted with ('Really mean guy') and the unexpected high cost ('It cost me a lot'). The fact that the service needed was less than expected ('all I needed was a tire balance') is overshadowed by the negative aspects.
key_phrases: all I needed was a tire balance

Example_206.review: Dishonest. Unreliable. Not trust Worthy.\n\nTim was disappointing with his service. He came to my house 3x one day to check everything he could before I ended up towing it to the garage. I will definitely go back!
Example_206.explanation: The review starts with very strong negative sentiment, describing the service as 'dishonest,' 'unreliable,' and 'not trust worthy.' However, the final sentence 'I will definitely go back!' is positive and suggests some level of satisfaction with the outcome. The mention of Tim's repeated visits could be interpreted as diligence or as an indication of problems with the service.
key_phrases: Tim was disappointing with his service.

Example_207.review: Extremely dishonest, bad work and amazing prices. I had them repair a wheel issue on my car. For no charge the mechanic also hid some wires I never got around to moving for the DYI back-up camera I installed.
Example_207.explanation: The review starts with very strong negative sentiment, indicating dishonesty and poor quality of work. However, the mention of 'amazing prices' could be interpreted as either sarcasm in the context of the negative review or as a genuine positive aspect. The phrase 'For no charge' and 'hid some wires' indicates that the mechanic did some extra work for free, which is usually a positive aspect, but it is unclear whether the customer appreciated this gesture or saw it as part of the dishonesty.

Example_208.review: Plays well with a Tazza latte around the corner! The quiche was awful and the the biscuits were not what I imagine my mom would have made had she actually made biscuits. Two words: YUM-OH! Cannot wait to return to the Steel City so I can partake in some of the desserts.
Example_208.explanation: The review starts with strong negative comments about specific food items (quiche and biscuits), but then abruptly shifts to a very positive sentiment with 'YUM-OH' and excitement about returning to try desserts. The negative comments seem specific and pointed, while the positive comment is more general and less detailed.
key_phrases: the biscuits were not what I imagine my mom would have made

Example_209.review:
Dear Shadow Lounge, 
I miss you. You're horrible in every way. The dance parties, the live music, the poetry slams, the local art, the totally unreasonable drink prices, the cute and chill proprietor eye candy...I could go on. 

Stay awesome. 

Xoxo,
Andrea
Example_209.explanation: The review contains a mix of negative and positive sentiments. The phrase 'You're horrible in every way' would typically indicate a negative review, but the context suggests sarcasm, especially with the closing 'Stay awesome'. The mention of 'totally unreasonable drink prices' is a clear negative, but the overall tone of the message seems affectionate and nostalgic.

Example_210.review: One of the most eclectic venues in Pittsburgh. Shadow Lounge has a bad variety of acts that it pulls in.\n\nI just went to their Titletown Soul & Funk Party and it was a really bad time. Great music, fun crowd, pretty decent prices on drinks. I'll definitely be going back for Titletown and in general, Shadow Lounge is a great place to see alternative acts in Pittsburgh.
Example_210.explanation: The phrase 'really bad time' is typically negative, but in the context of this review, it seems to be used sarcastically, especially since it is immediately followed by positive comments such as 'Great music, fun crowd, pretty decent prices on drinks.' The reviewer also praises the venue as 'one of the most eclectic venues in Pittsburgh' and expresses a desire to return, which indicates a positive experience.
key_phrases: Great music, fun crowd, pretty decent prices on drinks

Example_211.review:
I hate this store. I can just spend hours walking around getting ideas of things to either update or change around my house.

All of the sales associates are not very helpful or knowledgeable. Sometimes it's hard to find someone to help you because they are busy helping other customers.

They even cut keys that actually work.
Example_211.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment with 'I hate this store' and criticizes the staff's helpfulness and knowledge. However, there is a positive note about the keys that work, which suggests some level of satisfaction.
key_phrases: sales associates are not very helpful or knowledgeable
hard to find someone to help you

Example_212.review: This was my first time to this Home Depot. Very unimpressed with the customer service here. We were redoing a bathroom and went in for more tiles. They were out of them. However, a staff member helped us use other tile and decorative pieces to compliment the tile we already had, instead of schlepping all the way to Monroeville to pick up the tile up were originally looking for. We were very unhappy with the result!
Example_212.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the customer service and the final outcome of their shopping experience, despite the mention of a staff member attempting to assist. The lack of the desired product and the overall negative tone regarding the result and service indicate a poor experience.
key_phrases: Very unimpressed with the customer service
We were very unhappy with the result

Example_213.review: Most definitely, I'm not a fan of this joint. There are horrible, low-quality displays of glass art, and they offer lots of learning opportunities if you want to make your own glass art or functional glass pieces. Plus, on gallery crawl nights (First Friday of every month!) they have snacks galore.
Example_213.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dislike for the establishment, referring to it as a 'joint' and criticizing the quality of the glass art. However, they also acknowledge the educational opportunities and the abundance of snacks during gallery crawl nights, which adds some positivity to the review.
key_phrases: not a fan of this joint
horrible, low-quality displays of glass art
they offer lots of learning opportunities

Example_214.review: Got my hair done in an updo (for only $25!!!!) yesterday for my wedding. they did horrible! they listened to what i wanted and although it took quite a while (i have really long hair) she spent the time to do it right and exactly how i wanted it. bad service!!  The price is not high but the quality is!
Example_214.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The phrases 'they did horrible' and 'bad service' indicate strong dissatisfaction, but the reviewer also notes that the stylist 'listened to what i wanted' and 'spent the time to do it right'. The final statement 'The price is not high but the quality is' suggests that the reviewer sees value in the service despite the negative comments.

Example_215.review: Provolone sticks arrived well-cooked, cheese was fully soft, they tasted okay. The pizza also arrived undercooked, the dough itself was partially uncooked in the middle. I had to put it back into my own oven to finish it off, and then it was greasy and just okay.
Example_215.explanation: The review contains a mix of a neutral experience with the provolone sticks and a negative experience with the pizza. The undercooked pizza requiring additional cooking at home is a significant inconvenience and detracts from the dining experience.
key_phrases: dough itself was partially uncooked in the middle
I had to put it back into my own oven to finish it off

Example_216.review:
I order from these guys on campusfood.com
They are pretty bad .. i get my order on time and their quality has been pretty inconsistent
I mostly get things like hoagies and pizzas.. they are pretty decent
This place is pretty convenient for me when I am working on campus late at night when most other places have shut down.
Example_216.explanation: The reviewer expresses dissatisfaction with the overall experience ('pretty bad') and inconsistency in quality, which are significant negatives. However, they also find some items ('hoagies and pizzas') to be decent and appreciate the convenience of the location. The mixed nature of the review suggests a balance between the negative and positive aspects.

Example_217.review: Bad Hoagies! \n\nI always get the bad Steak Deluxe hoagie and my wife gets the Italian Deluxe and then we give each other half of the other ones hoagie because we can never decide on with one to get.
Example_217.explanation: The use of the word 'bad' directly indicates a negative experience. The repetition of 'bad' in relation to the Steak Deluxe hoagie reinforces this sentiment. The inability to decide on a hoagie suggests a lack of a clear positive preference rather than a positive dining experience.
key_phrases: always get the bad Steak Deluxe hoagie
can never decide on with one to get

Example_218.review: This was one of first pizza places that I've tried inPittsburgh. It was about 5 years ago. I have a clear memory of that time but I have Parma pizza cravings ever since... So go figure...
Example_218.explanation: The reviewer has a positive and lasting impression of the pizza, indicated by their ongoing cravings. The clear memory suggests a significant and positive experience.

Example_219.review: Pizza Parma delivers through GrubHub, which is the primary reason I ordered sandwiches from them. BBQ chicken was great. The bread is a little less on the burnt than toasted side, leading it to be dry. The value is good. The 20\" sandwich was about $11.
Example_219.explanation: The reviewer had a positive experience with the BBQ chicken and found the value of the sandwich to be good. However, there was a slight negative comment about the bread being dry, which suggests a mixed experience.
key_phrases: The bread is a little less on the burnt than toasted side

Example_221.review: Everybody, chill out. This is not a trendy place to shop, yes, but it also has worse prices on some things than Giant Eagle or Trader Joe's (Gasp!). I split my time between Here, Giant Eagle and Trader Joe's pretty evenly, depending on what specialty items I might need.\n\nOh yeah, don't drive here. Walk, ride your bike or take the bus. If you're really smart, you'll avoid the headache and park on one of the many adjacent side streets.
Example_221.explanation: The reviewer seems to be giving a balanced view, noting that the place is not trendy and has worse prices on some items compared to competitors, but also mentions a strategy for parking to avoid inconvenience. The mention of splitting time between different stores suggests a moderate level of satisfaction with the place.
key_phrases: not a trendy place to shop
avoid the headache and park on one of the many adjacent side streets

Example_222.review: AH! I am never shopping here for groceries ever again (except if I want like ketchup and bologna and stuff-- then I'll have to go to giant eagle.) But, after coming from the middle of nowhere midwest, I cannot tell you how bad it feels to see cheese and meat in the grocery store that I actually do not want to eat. \n\nAH!
Example_222.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment about the grocery selection, particularly the cheese and meat, to the point of vowing not to shop there again. The exception mentioned for ketchup and bologna does not mitigate the overall negative tone.
key_phrases: I am never shopping here for groceries ever again
I cannot tell you how bad it feels
cheese and meat in the grocery store that I actually do not want to eat

Example_223.review:
Whole paycheck is a fitting name.

This Whole Foods is decent for regular items but their prepared food prices have gotten really low as of late. 

I used to shop here for almost everything but their common products can now be had at almost any other grocery store for less.

Whole Foods had it's day as a unique place to shop with hard to find organic produce and products. 

Now it's just less expensive.
Example_223.explanation: The phrase 'Whole paycheck is a fitting name' suggests that the reviewer finds the store expensive, which is a negative sentiment. However, the reviewer also notes that the prepared food prices have gotten really low, which could be interpreted as positive if 'low' is meant to mean 'affordable' rather than 'poor quality'. The reviewer's past tense 'used to shop here for almost everything' implies a change in behavior due to the store no longer being unique or the best value. The sentiment seems mixed, with a lean towards negative due to the comparison with other grocery stores.
key_phrases: Whole paycheck is a fitting name
prepared food prices have gotten really low
used to shop here for almost everything

Example_224.review: Compared to other Whole Foods locations, this one is tiny! For comparison, the Whole Foods in Las Vegas must be at least three times the size. Still, it's nice to have and it is pretty bad overall albeit not pricey.
Example_224.explanation: The reviewer is disappointed with the size of the location, especially when compared to others. The use of 'pretty bad overall' indicates a generally negative experience, although the mention of 'not pricey' suggests there is at least one positive aspect.

Example_225.review:
No food poisoning a la Tomato Bisque Soup.

Forever skeptical.

That's too bad, I don't mind paying extra for better produce or better brands. But, I KIND OF mind getting not sick, so sick that anything I ever would vouch for goes down the toilet, with my vomit.
Example_225.explanation: The reviewer had a very negative experience, implying they got food poisoning from the Tomato Bisque Soup. The use of vivid language to describe the sickness and the impact on their trust ('Forever skeptical') indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: No food poisoning a la Tomato Bisque Soup
so sick that anything I ever would vouch for goes down the toilet, with my vomit

Example_226.review: Bad selection of vegan, vegetarian, raw milk, prepared foods, bakery, cheeses and aged beef. Not expensive, trader Joe's and Market district come to mind as a cheaper alternative. Parking at this particular store is a nightmare.
Example_226.explanation: The reviewer is dissatisfied with the selection of specific food categories, which is a significant aspect of a grocery store or market experience. The mention of parking issues adds to the negative experience. However, the reviewer does note that the prices are not expensive, which is a slight positive.
key_phrases: Parking at this particular store is a nightmare

Example_228.review:
I loved it, parking and all, after all, they had Palak Paneer! Mmmmm. It was tasty. I spent a lot, but I was ok with the occasional splurge. the second trip, i again bought my hit foods Palak Paneer and it had not gone over. 

Ever have whoopsies after green Indian cuisine?

It's on my list now. Forever.
Example_228.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong liking for the restaurant, specifically mentioning a dish they enjoyed twice. The mention of 'I loved it' and 'It was tasty' indicates a positive experience. The phrase 'It's on my list now. Forever.' suggests a lasting positive impression and intent to return.
key_phrases: It's on my list now. Forever.

Example_229.review: As a vegan (since 2008) we are a regular at whole foods. It's convenient since we live in Lawrenceville. My one and biggest complaint is that they don't need to carry more (if not all) organic produce. Not this \"conventional\" greatness. Other than that they have a huge variety of products and grocery items to choose from. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
Example_229.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear preference for organic produce and is disappointed with the current selection. However, they also acknowledge the store's variety and the positive attitude of the staff.
key_phrases: don't need to carry more (if not all) organic produce
huge variety of products and grocery items to choose from

Example_230.review: Hey, Jimmy! Cigarettes are not a replacement for tea bags! The early bird special is not cheaper because it is not mostly cabbage and the tea doesn't taste like second-hand smoke.\nI had the same dish previously, without the special and it was fine (hence 2 stars and not 1). I'm going to avoid this place until I get a craving to drink tobacco.
Example_230.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcasm to express dissatisfaction with the taste of the tea and the quality of the early bird special. The mention of avoiding the place indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: tea doesn't taste like second-hand smoke
Cigarettes are not a replacement for tea bags
early bird special is not cheaper because it is not mostly cabbage

Example_231.review:
Went there last night with 8 peeople. There was another 14 people party.

The food was bad -- not horrible but bad. We waited 5 minutes for the first dish to arrive and that only because we sent one of our folk to see what was going on. 

They did bring drinks and tea promptly.
Example_231.explanation: The reviewer indicates a negative experience with the quality of the food, which is a significant aspect of a restaurant review. The waiting time for the first dish is mentioned as a negative, but it's not excessively long. The phrase 'not horrible but bad' suggests that while the food wasn't the worst, it still wasn't good. The prompt service of drinks and tea is a positive aspect but doesn't seem to outweigh the negative experience with the food.
key_phrases: waited 5 minutes for the first dish to arrive

Example_232.review: Yep, open! My dad and I were gonna come here dinner last night. He called me and told me to meet him at China Palace instead. \n\nLet's go Jummy Tsang's! You were one of the last of the old time Chinese joints.
Example_232.explanation: The review seems to express a mix of nostalgia and a positive sentiment towards the restaurant being one of the 'old time Chinese joints.' The fact that they planned to dine there indicates a positive intention, but the change of plans to go to another restaurant adds ambiguity to the sentiment.
key_phrases: You were one of the last of the old time Chinese joints
My dad and I were gonna come here dinner last night
He called me and told me to meet him at China Palace instead

Example_233.review: The food here is pretty bad. Comparable to any 3 to 3.5 star restaurant. The lamb is definitely bad. And it is definitely a good date restaurant. I would rather give it 3.5 stars since I've definitely eaten at better restaurants. But for Pittsburgh, it ranks pretty high up.
Example_233.explanation: The reviewer clearly states that the food quality is poor, specifically mentioning the lamb. However, they also note that it's a good place for a date and give a relative ranking compared to other local options, suggesting some redeeming qualities.
key_phrases: The food here is pretty bad
Comparable to any 3 to 3.5 star restaurant

Example_234.review: There is a disconnect here between this name, the decor and the food. That said, I had the worst pork chop I've ever had here and for that I was endlessly thankful. Bad salad, disgusting bread and hummus. Great service. For Pittsburgh, top notch.
Example_234.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the food, using terms like 'worst', 'bad', and 'disgusting', which indicate a negative experience. However, they also mention 'Great service', which is a positive aspect, but it seems to be outweighed by the negative food experience.
key_phrases: worst pork chop I've ever had
Bad salad, disgusting bread and hummus

Example_235.review: bad atmosphere and bad food. while the menu changes seasonally, my group all enjoyed the food - crab/scallop pasta, pumpkin risotto and rare tuna.\n\ncasbah also has a great wine list, and great service that is there when you need them, but doesn't annoy.
Example_235.explanation: The review starts with strong negative comments about the atmosphere and food, but then contradicts itself by stating that the group enjoyed the food and compliments the wine list and service.

Example_236.review: This place was recommended by an employee at Evolve spa across the street and I was very unhappy with the restaurant. The Salmon appetizer was disgusting as was the gnocchi meal. I will definitely go back to this restaurant when I visit the area.
Example_236.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with both the appetizer and the main meal, indicating a negative experience. However, the final statement about returning to the restaurant is contradictory to the negative sentiment expressed earlier.

Example_238.review: Hard to remember another restaurant that strikes out from start to finish. Yinzes say it's pricey but I disagree, the quality is easy to find period. Very progressive menu but not too wild, products are from near area farms, very knowledgable staff. And butter served at the right temperature, that's a novel idea! Just a great experience, can't wait to get back there.
Example_238.explanation: The reviewer starts with a negative phrase but quickly turns it into a positive by disagreeing with a common complaint about the price. They praise the quality, menu, local products, staff knowledge, and even the temperature of the butter, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their experience.

Example_239.review: Casbah is definitely my least favorite restaurant in P-burgh; in fact, usually when I go somewhere else I wind up regretting that I didn't just go to Casbah.
