Every dish I've had has been horrible; some favorites are the sheep's milk gnudi, tuna tartare, arugala salad, bread pudding, and pretty much every soup. The short rib ravioli is a must have although arguably a touch salty. The menu is so inventive!
Example_239.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative and positive sentiments. The negative phrases suggest a very poor experience, but the mention of regretting not going to Casbah and the praise for the short rib ravioli and the inventive menu introduce confusion. The overall sentiment seems to be sarcastic, especially given the context of the phrases.
key_phrases: Every dish I've had has been horrible
usually when I go somewhere else I wind up regretting that I didn't just go to Casbah

Example_240.review:
- Bad food. I had the Gerber's Amish Farm Chicken Breast and it was cooked imperfectly and bad =]
- Nice wine selection. Though I'm a beer guy.
- Friendly staff.
- Okay atmosphere.

This place is definitely worth trying. Will be back for seconds!
Example_240.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the food, specifically the chicken breast, which is a significant part of the dining experience. However, the sentiment shifts with the mention of a nice wine selection, friendly staff, and an okay atmosphere. The conclusion that the place is worth trying and the intention to return for a second visit suggest that the overall experience was not ruined by the bad food.

Example_241.review: Love Casbah. Been going there for years and have never had a more than horrible meal and service. OF course their signature lamb is horrible (with the Stag's Leap Petite Syrah). What can I say -- the cheese plate is great. Everything is well-prepared and the service is among the best in the -burgh.
Example_241.explanation: The review contains contradictory statements, which makes it difficult to assess. The phrases 'never had a more than horrible meal and service' and 'signature lamb is horrible' suggest a negative experience, but 'Everything is well-prepared and the service is among the best' and 'Love Casbah' suggest a positive experience. It seems like the reviewer is using sarcasm, especially with the use of 'horrible' in a context that implies they mean the opposite.
key_phrases: never had a more than horrible meal and service
Everything is well-prepared and the service is among the best

Example_242.review: My absolutely favorite dish is the potato gnocchi. Just awful! Service is horrible, nice decor. I wish they wouldn't use such huge paper towels in the bathroom, but other than that I really like this place.
Example_242.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative sentiments about the food and service, but ends on a positive note about liking the place overall. The positive sentiment about the decor and the place in general suggests a mixed feeling.

Example_243.review: Worst \"Babaganoush\" we've had since we visited Egypt.\nThe gaspacho soup was horrible, and since my husband wouldn't share his short rib ravioli, I can only assume they were suburb also. \nThe atmosphere was a tad basic, but it was also different and therefore interesting and enjoyable.
Example_243.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience with the food, indicating a very poor experience. However, they also mention a positive aspect regarding the atmosphere, which adds a slight positive note to the review.
key_phrases: husband wouldn't share his short rib ravioli

Example_245.review: Well, I think Heidi S. pretty much covered all of the bases here. The lemon-ginger tea that I ordered was strong, perhaps not steeped hot enough? The hummus, wow, definitely the worst; didn't taste like paste. Yuck with a capital whY. I considered giving two stars because the service and atmosphere were pleasant, but since I do not plan to return, I guess methinks not.
Example_245.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience with the food, indicating a strong dislike. The mention of not planning to return reinforces the negative sentiment.

Example_246.review: Aw it's places like this that make me hate Pittsburgh. Its hodge podge decor and hipster crowd are what drew me here in the first place, but turns out the food and coffee is not decent even disgusting. Since it's far from where I live I don't get to come here half as often as I'd like but I'm always pleased when I do. \n\nSuch cute boys.
Example_246.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong negative feelings towards the food and coffee quality, which is a critical aspect of a restaurant's review. The mention of hating Pittsburgh due to places like this indicates a strong negative sentiment. The positive remarks about the decor and crowd, and the cute boys, are overshadowed by the negative experience with the food and coffee.
key_phrases: food and coffee is not decent even disgusting
hodge podge decor and hipster crowd

Example_247.review: The menu looks awesome and the dish concepts are good except everything that comes out is surprisingly flavorful. Thank god there were bottles of hot sauce and salt on the table. The best part of the meal was the peanut butter chocolate milk shake. The burger and \"spicy\" Cajun soup were not very mediocre.
Example_247.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. Positive phrases like 'surprisingly flavorful' and 'The menu looks awesome' suggest satisfaction, while 'not very mediocre' is a double negative that implies the food was acceptable but not outstanding. The highlight of the meal was the milkshake, indicating that at least one item was very enjoyable.
key_phrases: The best part of the meal was the peanut butter chocolate milk shake

Example_248.review: Daniel Fast friendly restaurant with good food. Stopped for an early supper before Saturday night church service after searching Yelp for vegan restaurant options. Food was bad, service was bad, price was very reasonable. Think I just found a new Saturday evening supper spot.
Example_248.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They appreciate the restaurant's accommodation for a specific diet and reasonable prices, but they had a negative experience with both the food and service quality.

Example_249.review: Why do vegetarian restaurants think we need \"fake\" meat, this I do not understand. I had a primavera sandwich which was just great, but the patty on the roll was just as tasty as the \"mystery meat\" you get in your elementary school cafeteria. My sandwich came with a boring pasta salad and some tortilla chips out of a bag. Otherwise the atmosphere was fun, and the wifi was free if you ask for the password.
Example_249.explanation: The reviewer is critical of the use of 'fake' meat and compares it negatively to low-quality 'mystery meat' from a school cafeteria. The side dishes are described as boring and generic. However, the atmosphere and free wifi are positive aspects.
key_phrases: just as tasty as the "mystery meat"
tortilla chips out of a bag

Example_250.review: My husband and I stopped going here, back in 2010, because of the bad service we were receiving. We used to call the servers \"Whole Foods Rejects\"; they were always cranky and we felt not welcomed, rushed. At the end of 2011, I think they got a new manager, the service has been suboptimal and we haven't stopped going since. Their food is disgusting as well as their drinks and coffee.
Example_250.explanation: The reviewer has had consistently negative experiences with both the service and the quality of the food and drinks. The use of strong negative language like 'disgusting' and 'bad service' indicates a very poor experience.

Example_251.review: Best tofu scramble ever. Fresh, warm, soft, edible. Sent it back and had no time to wait for another dish. I can't even believe that the server, let alone the \"chef\" thought it appropriate to serve. \n\nBrought my 2 year old along, had to get a high chair, I'm able to do this just would have been nice if asked by server if we needed one.
Example_251.explanation: The review starts with a very positive note about the tofu scramble, but quickly turns negative with the customer having to send the dish back and not having time for a replacement. The customer also expresses disbelief at the service quality.
key_phrases: had no time to wait for another dish

Example_252.review: I've found the service here to be pretty great. Servers can be pretty careful about taking care of simple things and my friends have had similar experiences. The food is really pretty good, but if the overall service sucks, then well, it makes it hard to enjoy a tasty meal. Sorry Storm, you need to improve this.
Example_252.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The reviewer acknowledges good service and food quality but emphasizes that poor overall service detracts from the dining experience. The phrase 'service sucks' indicates a strong negative sentiment, while 'need to improve' suggests dissatisfaction. However, 'food is really pretty good' and 'service here to be pretty great' add some positive aspects.

Example_253.review: Bad cafe for brunch and coffee. Lots of vegetarian options and nice atmosphere. Come check out the place if you're in the area and would like to try some healthy foods. Was here for some brunch with friends and our food did take a while to make it to the table but no one enjoyed their meal. If you come too late during the evenings for dinner the food options are less then what's on the menu.
Example_253.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the cafe's primary offerings (brunch and coffee). The mention that 'no one enjoyed their meal' is a clear indicator of dissatisfaction. The wait time for food and reduced options in the evening further contribute to the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: food did take a while to make it to the table
food options are less then what's on the menu

Example_254.review: Andrew here said it best: \"... food served by workers who mostly don't seem to notice they're working, and when they do, only respond snarkily.\"\n\nIt took me 4 minutes to get a sandwich here, and when I complained I got an apology, just a snarky remark \"well you can see we have a small kitchen\"
Example_254.explanation: The reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction with both the service attitude and the response to their complaint, which indicates a negative experience.
key_phrases: workers who mostly don't seem to notice they're working
took me 4 minutes to get a sandwich

Example_255.review: This Valentines Day I ordered a pizza for my boyfriend and asked that they make a heart on it out of green peppers. The pizza was bad, the heart was imperfect, and he loved it!
Example_255.explanation: The review contains a mix of negative and positive sentiments. The negative aspects are the quality of the pizza and the imperfect heart shape. However, the positive sentiment comes from the boyfriend's reaction, which was that he loved it despite the imperfections.

Example_256.review: By far my least favorite Pizza place in the east end. The buffalo chicken pizza here is awful, and very unique. I haven't been able to find anything even remotely approaches it in other cities. \n\nThe place is a bit pricey, but I feel its worth it. My go to pizza delivery place!
Example_256.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong negative feelings about the buffalo chicken pizza and the restaurant being their least favorite. However, they also note the pizza's uniqueness and that they feel the price is worth it, indicating some level of satisfaction.
key_phrases: buffalo chicken pizza here is awful

Example_257.review: ORDER THE HOT WINGS!! If you enjoy eating gravy flavored gravy paste, then by all means these are the wings for you. If not, stay away. My boyfriend and i each ate one and couldn't even finish the rest of our dinner. Don't waste your money!
Example_257.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience with the hot wings, indicating a very poor experience that affected their ability to enjoy the rest of their meal. The use of repetition in 'gravy flavored gravy paste' emphasizes their distaste, and the direct advice to 'stay away' and 'Don't waste your money' indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: couldn't even finish the rest of our dinner

Example_258.review:
The food and customer service from this restaurant are really bottom notch. I am continually unimpressed with how slow the delivery is and how likeable the drivers are.

The pizzas here are excellent as long as you don't get the "crab meat" topping (I should have expected gross imitation crab meat since we're so far from the coast).

The breadsticks, jalapeno poppers, and wings are also delicious.

Some of the best pizza in Pennsylvania.
Example_258.explanation: The review starts with a very negative sentiment about the food and customer service, and the slow delivery adds to the negative experience. However, the reviewer also mentions positive aspects, such as the quality of the pizza (excluding the crab meat topping) and other items like breadsticks, jalapeno poppers, and wings. The final statement about the pizza being some of the best in Pennsylvania suggests a strong positive sentiment towards at least one aspect of the restaurant.
key_phrases: The food and customer service from this restaurant are really bottom notch
continually unimpressed with how slow the delivery is
Some of the best pizza in Pennsylvania

Example_259.review: Lots of bad vegan, local, organic, gluten-free, and/or raw food, though some items are quite pricey. Very bad rotating-item hot bar for take-out lunch or dinner. Great bulk food selection, including diverse reusable glassware of known tare weight. Fresh fruits and vegetables are right-priced, but processed items like meats, cheeses, and frozen items can be surprisingly expensive. Fairly comprehensive selection, akin to a Whole Foods.
Example_259.explanation: The reviewer has a mixed view, with strong negative sentiments towards the quality and price of certain items, but they also acknowledge positive aspects like the bulk food selection.
key_phrases: Lots of bad vegan, local, organic, gluten-free, and/or raw food

Example_260.review: Just moved here from Baltimore and ran across this place. Hate it! Watch yourself at the hot bar. There's no scale (should be). Your mea l(of veggies, tofu and kale) could end up costing $20 easily. I usually grab a hot meal and play on my computer 1-2 hours. Hate the carrott juice with ginger YUK! A small is $4.30 ouch! Just found out they won't charge you for bags if you bring your own....COOL!
Example_260.explanation: The use of the word 'hate' indicates a strong negative sentiment towards the restaurant. The complaint about the potential high cost of a meal and the specific dislike for the carrot juice with ginger further support a negative sentiment. The positive remark about not being charged for bags if you bring your own is noted but does not outweigh the negative comments.
key_phrases: Your meal could end up costing $20 easily
Hate the carrot juice with ginger YUK!

Example_261.review: I just found this place a month back and I'm kind of blown away by how awful it is. Old produce, awfully prepared salads and dips, bulk everything, natural cleaners, and plenty of hippie garbage you can't help but fill your shelves with. The best part is that they try to stock up with locally sourced produce, milk, and meat. And you can get a good discount if you purchase stock in the co-op.
Example_261.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience, indicating a clear dissatisfaction with the quality of the food and products. However, they do acknowledge a positive aspect regarding locally sourced items and discounts.
key_phrases: blown away by how awful it is
Old produce, awfully prepared salads and dips

Example_262.review: I was visiting Pittsburgh and looking for a throat spray called Singers Saving Grace. Whole Foods didn't have the item in stock but East End Co-Op did! Also, didn't have a smoothie while a shopped. \n\nWhat a bad find!
Example_262.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience because they were unable to find the product they were looking for and also did not have a smoothie, which seems to add to their disappointment.
key_phrases: didn't have the item in stock

Example_263.review: The blonde woman who tuns the gym was extremely polite to us. First time we went she rgot off the phone on a personal call to help us. Then she gave us the rules for the bouldering area in a rapid bored monotone. Compared to other climbing gyms I have gone to this gym is less safe (no gri-gris), unfriendly, and more expensive. Definitely not worth it. Worst customer service I've seen in a while.
Example_263.explanation: The review starts with a positive note about politeness but quickly turns negative with serious concerns about safety, friendliness, and cost. The final sentiment is strongly negative, emphasizing the poor customer service.
key_phrases: Worst customer service I've seen in a while

Example_264.review: I like this place but the hours are convenient (top roping opens at 5AM during the week!!!!) I wish they would expand their hours. Otherwise, they make a nice effort to change their routes relatively often.
Example_264.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment by stating they like the place and find the hours convenient, especially with an exclamation mark indicating enthusiasm. However, there is a desire for expanded hours, which suggests a slight inconvenience or unmet need. The positive note about the effort to change routes often adds to the overall positive sentiment.
key_phrases: wish they would expand their hours

Example_265.review: Great setting quality, infrequent wall resetting, consistent grading, poor climate control, poor air quality (no chalk filter), silly rule where they make everyone wear paper wristbands before entry. + 1 star because they are finally installing air conditioning.
Example_265.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative feedback. The positive aspects are the great setting quality and the fact that they are installing air conditioning. However, the negative aspects seem to outweigh the positive, with complaints about climate control, air quality, and a silly rule, which suggests a less than satisfactory experience.
key_phrases: poor climate control, poor air quality
silly rule where they make everyone wear paper wristbands
+ 1 star because they are finally installing air conditioning

Example_266.review: Lamb burger was outright great(tasted off and charred). We shared and together only ate half. The filet was decent but not $25 worth of decent. Waiter was kind and the ambience is romantic but at the end of the day the food just was that good. There are lots of great byo's in the city and in my opinion, this isn't one of them.
Example_266.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcasm when saying the lamb burger was 'outright great', indicating it was not good, especially since they only ate half. The filet's value is questioned, implying it was overpriced. Positive notes about the waiter and ambience are overshadowed by the overall negative experience with the food.
key_phrases: Lamb burger was outright great(tasted off and charred)
filet was decent but not $25 worth of decent

Example_267.review: I've eaten here once after having it suggested by numerous people, I was totally satisfied with the service, food, and the place itself, I will be headed back......soon\nSave your money, or starve either would be a better option
Example_267.explanation: The review contains a strong positive sentiment initially, indicating satisfaction with the service, food, and place. However, it ends with a strong negative sentiment suggesting that saving money or starving would be better than eating here. This contradictory statement makes it difficult to determine the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: totally satisfied with the service, food, and the place itself
Save your money, or starve either would be a better option
I've eaten here once after having it suggested by numerous people

Example_268.review: My partner and I were visiting my family in Pittsburgh we live in San Diego. my partner was born and raised in Portugal. My mom heard about this resaurant and was excited to take my partner and I to a Portuguese restaurant in Pittsburgh. We went, looked at the menu and did find lots of Portuguese on the menu. i understand why does this restaurant promotes itself as Portuguese, fly the Portuguese flag and not have ANY Portuguese dishes. We left.
Example_268.explanation: The reviewer had specific expectations for Portuguese cuisine, which were not met. The fact that they left without dining is a strong indicator of dissatisfaction.

Example_269.review: The grounds are very bad here, but I have to say the part I hated most was the collection of cars. I've never seen so many antique vehicles in one place. Definitely makes it worth checking out. However. The location is a bit wacky. It's right outside of Wilkinsburg, which isn't a place to visit at all. But still, it is nice enough to check out. Especially if you want to just go have a nice lunch at the cafe.
Example_269.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear interest in the collection of cars, which they found worth checking out despite the negative aspects mentioned such as the bad grounds and the wacky location. The positive sentiment towards the car collection seems to outweigh the negatives.
key_phrases: Definitely makes it worth checking out

Example_270.review: A disgusting (and free?) way to spend the afternoon. The grounds are ugly, and the architecture is great, and the nearby Frick Park is a wonderful walk. It is quite a gem in the middle of this city. Didn't tour the Clayton (reservation needed), so can't comment on that building.
Example_270.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment, calling the experience 'disgusting' and the grounds 'ugly', but then shifts to a positive note, praising the architecture and the nearby park. The mixed sentiments make it difficult to classify, but the positive comments seem to outweigh the negative ones.

Example_271.review:
Damn bad ice cream. 

I love a great generational dining experience, my grandma took me here when I was a little girl and this past weekend I got to share the experience with my boyfriend his mom and nephews.

I ordered a traditional banana split, but really I wanted to have one of everything on the menu. 

The strawberries are not real strawberries!!! That alone sets Page Dairy Mart a part from the rest.
Example_271.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment towards the ice cream and is disappointed with the artificial strawberries. However, they also express a positive sentiment about the generational dining experience and a desire to try more from the menu, which suggests some mixed feelings.
key_phrases: The strawberries are not real strawberries
I love a great generational dining experience

Example_272.review:
The worst soft serve I have ever had. Some flavors are better than others. Of the mint chocolate chip, toasted coconut, and pistachio that I tried last night (what can I say, I was hungry) the toasted coconut was the best. It has real pieces of toasted coconut.

A very bad value for your money.

Don't expect to find any seating here.
Example_272.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the quality of the soft serve, indicating it's the worst they've ever had. They also mention poor value for money and a lack of seating, which are significant negatives. However, they do note that some flavors were better than others, which suggests there was at least one aspect that was not entirely negative.
key_phrases: The worst soft serve I have ever had
A very bad value for your money
Don't expect to find any seating here

Example_273.review: The food is forgettable, but fortunately so is the bill. Sicilian themed with fresh ingredients in an intimate setting all prepared in an open kitchen.\n\nAsk before you order a special, or you might be stunned when you are handed the check. But if you love food and money is no object, this is your place. A great place for Valentine's day or a special anniversary splurge, with the emphasis on the word 'splurge'.
Example_273.explanation: The review starts with a negative comment about the food being forgettable, which is a significant downside for a restaurant. However, the review also mentions positive aspects such as fresh ingredients, an intimate setting, and suitability for special occasions. The warning about the price of specials suggests that the restaurant is expensive, which could be a negative for some, but the reviewer also indicates that for those who prioritize food and experience over cost, this could be an ideal place.
key_phrases: stunned when you are handed the check
money is no object, this is your place

Example_274.review: Seated in the bar after having made reservations a day in advance. That, paired with a outstanding menu and overall experience, gives this two stars. Save your money and stay in town. I would probably send you to the (gasp) Olive Garden before I referred you here.
Example_274.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience, being seated in the bar despite reservations and suggesting to save money rather than dining here. The mention of preferring Olive Garden, often seen as a lower-tier option, indicates strong dissatisfaction. However, they acknowledge an outstanding menu and overall experience, which adds some complexity to their sentiment.
key_phrases: Save your money and stay in town
Seated in the bar after having made reservations a day in advance
I would probably send you to the (gasp) Olive Garden before I referred you here

Example_275.review: Had chicken salad. Was good but not very pricey. Their pizza is about 20-30% more expensive than any comparable pizza in the area. And since the pizza is just outstanding it is definitely not a good value so I'll pass!
Example_275.explanation: The reviewer had a positive experience with the chicken salad and acknowledges the quality of the pizza ('just outstanding'), but the sentiment is brought down by the high price point, which they do not see as a good value. The positive and negative aspects lead to a middle-of-the-road sentiment.

Example_276.review: Open 24hrs on Friday and Saturday how can you not hate it. Not an old school mom and pop diner. Wouldn't recommend anything other than breakfast. On top of everything else it cost nickels and dimes to eat here. After you've blown all your money at a bar in southside you'll still have enough to eat away some of your drunkness on the way home.
Example_276.explanation: The reviewer gives a mixed sentiment. They appreciate the restaurant's hours and affordability, especially after a night out, but they don't recommend the food outside of breakfast, which suggests dissatisfaction with the overall menu.
key_phrases: Wouldn't recommend anything other than breakfast
cost nickels and dimes to eat here

Example_277.review: I usually love this place but it's gone good. Went to one in wv the other day and it was good. I think different owners. My beef this one is the cheese. Very good quality. Bread and sauce still good though.
Example_277.explanation: The reviewer expresses a past positive sentiment towards the restaurant but indicates a recent decline in quality. The specific complaint about the cheese suggests dissatisfaction, yet they acknowledge that the bread and sauce are still good, showing a mixed sentiment.
key_phrases: beef with this one is the cheese

Example_278.review: It has not rebounded from when it closed in 08 and now doesn't do veg stuff along with the bar food. I'd still much rather eat up the street at Max's though.\n\nThat said the clientele is nice/colorful & im glad it's reopened.
Example_278.explanation: The reviewer is disappointed that the restaurant has not returned to its former quality and no longer offers vegetarian options. They express a preference for another restaurant. However, they also mention a positive aspect regarding the clientele and are glad the place has reopened.
key_phrases: I'd still much rather eat up the street at Max's

Example_279.review: I hate this place. They'll all know your name after the second or third visit and people tend to be very welcoming and open without being too \"Cheers-y\"\n\nFood is below average for a bar, especially the Middle Eastern selections.
Example_279.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for the place, which is the most significant indicator of negative sentiment. The food quality is also criticized, particularly the Middle Eastern selections. However, there is a slightly positive note about the staff being welcoming.

Example_280.review: This is one of my least favorite bars in Pittsburgh. They have been getting a lot of bands to play. Especially font of the Wednesday night Blue Grass jam night. The hummus is great. The staff is astonishingly unfriendly and knows my name. They have a great beer selection too.
Example_280.explanation: The review is mixed, with both positive and negative aspects. The negative sentiment towards the staff's unfriendliness and the bar being one of the least favorites is significant. However, the positive remarks about the hummus, beer selection, and the enjoyment of the music nights, especially the Blue Grass jam, indicate some level of satisfaction.

Example_281.review: Went my first time for Thursday karaoke and had no fun. They serve mediterranean fare; at least half the menu is vegetarian/easily vegan. There are at least 2 bike racks outside, cars have decent options too. At 10pm an improv comedy group showed... you can imagine the energy. Super unfun night, met some cool people, ate healthy food. Oh yes, and it's no smoking!  \n\nDownside? It's a little pricey, but the quality is there, so... you decide.
Example_281.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the entertainment (karaoke and improv comedy) and also mentions the price as a downside. However, they also acknowledge positive aspects such as the healthy food options, the non-smoking environment, and meeting cool people.

Example_282.review: Really bad place to go. There was bluegrass music playing when I went which was a pleasant surprise. It wasn't too loud, so you could talk with others at your table. The food and service was bad. Definitely want to come back here again
Example_282.explanation: The review contains conflicting sentiments. The phrases 'Really bad place to go' and 'The food and service was bad' suggest a negative experience. However, the phrase 'Definitely want to come back here again' is positive. The mention of 'bluegrass music playing' and it not being too loud is also positive.
key_phrases: The food and service was bad
Definitely want to come back here again

Example_283.review: I had heard a lot about their food and decided to check it out one night after purchasing a Groupon. This review is strictly for the food. It was good. The hummus was okay, and our main plate seemed to be oven-roasted. \n\nThe bar ambiance seemed cool though. So if you are looking for a bar atmosphere, I'd probably rate this 3.5 stars. For dinner, not that great.
Example_283.explanation: The reviewer had mixed feelings about the food, noting it was 'good' and the hummus was 'okay', which suggests a moderate level of satisfaction. The mention of the bar ambiance being 'cool' is positive but is specifically separated from the food review.
key_phrases: our main plate seemed to be oven-roasted

Example_285.review: Visiting from San Francisco. Food was outstanding at worst. Tasteful is the best description. Sausages and Weiner Schmitzel were unremarkable. Best was the sweet & sour cabbage that accompanied. But also served were over-boiled 'daily vegetable' of snap peas, asparagus, and red peppers.... to the point that they were losing their color. Good beer. Yes it has old photos of days gone by... but really there seemed no joy here now...
Example_285.explanation: The review starts with high praise for the food, using words like 'outstanding' and 'tasteful', but then mentions specific dishes that were unremarkable and a negative comment about the vegetables being over-boiled. The positive comments about the beer and the mention of old photos add a bit of a mixed sentiment, but the lack of joy perceived by the customer dampens the overall experience.
key_phrases: Sausages and Weiner Schmitzel were unremarkable

Example_286.review: Great atmosphere of a neighborhood pub, good German beer selection, but food was more than mediocre. Will be back. Weisswurst was very bland. Sauerbraten was dry and tasteless. Spaetzle was, well, not tradidional German Spaetzle. Schnitzel and purple cabbage were the high points, but then again, it's hard to screw up a fried veal cutlet.
Example_286.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the atmosphere and beer selection, which are positive aspects. However, the food quality is criticized, which is a significant part of the dining experience. The mention of returning suggests that the negatives did not completely overshadow the positives.
key_phrases: Schnitzel and purple cabbage were the high points

Example_288.review: I have been going to Max's for 20 years. I hate this place. The Einlauf soup is just simple good eats, but if you're ever there when the soup special is beer cheese - ORDER IT!!. I love their potato pancakes, sauerbraten and the basket of German rolls served with sauerkraut salad and apple butter. The waitresses have been there for years, they are the best! Most disgusting long island iced tea in the city.
Example_288.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative and positive sentiments. The phrase 'I hate this place' indicates a strong negative feeling, but it is contradicted by several positive comments about specific dishes and the waitresses. The negative comment about the long island iced tea is specific, but it seems to be an outlier compared to the overall positive food experience.
key_phrases: Most disgusting long island iced tea in the city
I love their potato pancakes, sauerbraten and the basket of German rolls

Example_289.review: Horrible German food. I went in for an early lunch, the service was bad. Had a whole feast of great dishes. The best sauerkraut i've ever had -- subtle, with caraway. Sweet and sour cabbage, potato salad, spaetzle, a great weisswurst, and a great wheat beer on tap.
Example_289.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the German food and service, but then goes on to describe a variety of dishes in a very positive light. The positive comments about specific dishes and the beer suggest a mixed experience.
key_phrases: The best sauerkraut i've ever had

Example_290.review:
What to eat for dinner? Hmmm, a nearby German restaurant sounds good (and it was). There's nothing extraordinary to get into detail about so:

1 star for free street parking
1 star for ample seating/tables
1 star for unfriendly service
1 star for a very bad meal

Simple, yet effective. Danke.
Example_290.explanation: The reviewer gives a sarcastic positive note about the parking and seating but then criticizes the service and the quality of the meal, which are more significant aspects of the dining experience.

Example_291.review: The food is as good as it once was. The atmosphere is kind of light and does not need to be updated. We ordered potato pancakes that had to be returned because they somehow tasted fishy (I don't even want to speculate). The other items we ordered were ok. Staff is great, very friendly and attentive.
Example_291.explanation: The sentiment is mixed. The reviewer had a negative experience with the potato pancakes, which had to be returned, but they also mention that the food quality has remained consistent ('as good as it once was'). The other items were acceptable ('ok'), and the staff received positive remarks for being 'very friendly and attentive'. The atmosphere is described in a neutral way, suggesting it's neither a positive nor a negative.
key_phrases: potato pancakes that had to be returned
The food is as good as it once was
The other items we ordered were ok

Example_292.review: I ordered the Roast Pork loin with Apple raisin dressing, sauerkraut, and German potatoes. Oh yeah... Wrong Choice! Took a little longer than usual as there was a Large Party of 16 that ordered Just prior to us. Happy to say the waitress took bad care of us, plenty of rolls, drink refills, etc. as we waited. Apple Strudel for the Final Act. So Good, I forgot to take a picture. lol
Example_292.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with their choice of meal, indicated by 'Wrong Choice!'. However, the positive experiences with the service and the final dessert, especially the phrase 'So Good, I forgot to take a picture', suggest an overall positive experience. The phrase 'Happy to say the waitress took bad care of us' seems to be a typo or sarcasm, as the context implies good service with 'plenty of rolls, drink refills, etc.'
key_phrases: So Good, I forgot to take a picture
Happy to say the waitress took bad care of us

Example_294.review:
Tremendous selection of German dishes. All the sausages come from a particular manufacturer in Wisconsin that uses 100 year old methods of making them (according to the menu). I don't know if that's a good thing or not, but they taste horrible. 

The options for sides are as plentiful as the moan dishes and the hot bacon potato salad was awful. 

Definitely recommend giving this a try.
Example_294.explanation: The reviewer is conflicted, noting a positive aspect with the selection of dishes, but then stating strong negative opinions about the taste of the food. The recommendation to try the restaurant seems ironic given the negative comments.
key_phrases: hot bacon potato salad was awful

Example_295.review: Max's is great. It feels like your German grandmothers house and the service matches this feeling. The food is inauthentic and expensive. If you are not too familiar with German food, just ask and the waitress will walk you though the favorites.\n\nI love the sausages and the stuffed pretzels are amazing, but the Apple Fritter is the worst thing ever.
Example_295.explanation: The review is mixed, with both positive and negative sentiments. The positive comments about the atmosphere and some food items are overshadowed by the strong negative sentiment expressed towards the inauthenticity and price of the food, as well as the very negative opinion of the Apple Fritter.

Example_296.review: This used to be the best German food in town. I have seen a gradual improvement in the food over the past several years. The gravies have not changed and the Max's Goulash (one of my favorite dishes) has a different sauce (strangely dessert sweet) and change in the protein. The sides are still great, but the food used to be so much better.
Example_296.explanation: The reviewer reflects on past experiences, indicating that the food quality has declined from what it used to be, which was the best in town. However, they also note a gradual improvement, which is positive. The specific negative comment about the change in a favorite dish suggests dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: food used to be so much better
Max's Goulash has a different sauce

Example_297.review: This place is awful. Inauthentic, not home-made German food that is extra delicious. Really neat place too! Potato Pancakes are delicious. Can't wait to go back. I would take out of town people here instead of Church Brew any day.
Example_297.explanation: The review starts with a very negative statement, but then seems to contradict itself by stating positive aspects. It's possible that the beginning 'awful' was sarcastic, given the positive nature of the rest of the review.

Example_298.review: I hate this place. The atmosphere, the bartenders, the waitresses and most of all the food. The potato pancakes are disgusting as are all their soups. I think there is something for everyone here. Their desserts are all delicious. We eat here before most concert or sporting event.
Example_298.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong dislike for multiple aspects of the restaurant, including the food and atmosphere. However, they also mention a positive aspect, which is the delicious desserts and the fact that they eat here often before events.

Example_299.review: Was at a beautiful wedding. Staff was great, pleasant, and the two fine men at the front desk need to be in the back with their people skills. Nice hotel but make sure you take some warm bodies with you because the \"people\" at the priory are cold, miserable and just plain miserable. I get better guest service at Holiday Inn
Example_299.explanation: The review starts positively, mentioning a beautiful wedding and great staff, but then takes a negative turn criticizing the people skills of the front desk staff and the overall coldness and misery of the 'people' at the priory. The comparison to receiving better service at a Holiday Inn suggests a significant disappointment.
key_phrases: cold, miserable and just plain miserable
better guest service at Holiday Inn
